Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: BrookeM06
Reviews.Content: I visited Hotel Indigo back in February of this year and had a pretty nice experience. My ONLY big complaint was there was someone had their dog in the next room and let the dog drag its leash around the wood floor from 4am-6am. It was very irritating. Also check out time was at 11am and housekeeping was knocking at doors at 10:15. Other than that, everything was great. Amazing customer service and that is what will get me to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Really quite excellent...”
Reviews.Author: mjs7777
Reviews.Content: Can't find anything to fault here really. All the staff were helpful and everything was in working order. The rooms have sort of a Willy Wonka meets Ikea feel - still not sure if I actually like the design but everything was clean and spacious, so no complaints. A friend visited and we tried the 9th floor terrace. Great space, view, and firepit action... Also had breakfast in the restaurant. Excellent service and food. Really top notch. Since it was a Sunday night with no baseball game, there was no trouble parking at a meter overnight and then paying the meter to stay through breakfast. To top it all off, my stay was actually free, as compensation for a reservation issue with the corporate office. There was no obvious difference from the staff because of it! No attitude at all. I was really impressed, actually. Have tried a few other hotels in downtown San Diego and this is definitely my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, spacious rooms with great service and great location”
Reviews.Author: pinchivida
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Indigo Hotel couple months ago and the hotel is perfectly located in the Gaslamp District, a block away from Petco Park. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are beautiful. Our room had hardwood floor, a huge bathroom and an amazing view of downtown SD. We had a beer at the rooftop terrace and it was super calm and relaxing and for whom ever that has a dog this is the perfect place to stay at, it is a very dog friendly hotel, and for those that do not have dogs the hotel is super clean. Recommend anybody that wants to stay for business or a romantinc getaway for couples. The only downside is that the hotel does not have a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Bring The Dog”
Reviews.Author: prosailortim
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 4/14/12 with my wife & our dog. We live fairly close to San Diego and since the kids were gone off to the in laws for the night I decided to give this hotel a shot. I'm a Holiday Inn priority club member & this hotel is part of there chain. I booked this room on line at the last minute using some of my accumulated points and also the whole hotel is pet friendly (no extra charge for pets). I booked a room with a king size bed, while checking inn the staff upgraded us to a suite on the top (12th floor) floor. We were like "WOW" a beautiful room w/view. On the 9th. floor they have a grass area where pets can do their business, a big bonus if you bring fido. The downstairs bar & restaurant area were very nice as well. Had a couple of drinks before heading out (drinks were awesome) & breakfast the following morning. Breakfast was good, limited menu and kinda pricey, still a good deal since your dog is also welcomed. Parking @ $38.00 a night is expensive you need to consider your options though. Either put coins in a meter every 2 hours (more expensive) or park a few blocks away at a 24 hr. parking lot near the stadium (not the best area to leave your sports car overnight). People you're in a city atmosphere, parking always comes at a premium. I would have gave this a 5 star rating only if they had better pillows on there beds. Pillows needed to be twice the size and softer. That was my only complaint, I'll be coming back this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern dog friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Michelle522
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous. It has an awesome rooftop bar that overlooks Petco Park and just a few blocks from Gaslamp Quarter. For those that are not fond of dogs, it is still a great choice. All dogs are leashed when in the lobby or other parts of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff attitude is AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: DINKs312
Reviews.Content: I could go on and on about how great the rooms were, the food, the view from the roof top bar, or the super convenient location. However, it was the general attitude from the entire team that made this trip stand out. EVERYONE said hello, everyone smiled, and everyone seemed happy to be there and happy to help. It honestly put me in a good mood every day. Way to go Team Indigo!

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: 1570Green
Reviews.Content: Location, location. location! About 2 blocks from Petco Park (a # of bars) and a very short walk to the Gas Lamp district (lots of dinning and adult beverage choices). A number of condo towers are in the surrounding blocks so the street area has a urban neighborhood feel. The hotel is new (around 3 yrs old), rooms are tastefully decorated and the staff were helpful. Best of all, the hotel accepts dogs - our next visit will include Sammie (our Jack Russell).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel in a great part of town”
Reviews.Author: Scottsdale1
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting San Diego, this is a great hotel to stay at both for excellent experience as well as the joy of Gaslight district. The staff were very friendly, at check in, in the bars and restaurant. The rooms are large with hardwood floors and spacious bath areas. The hotel is very pet friendly, bummed that I didn't bring my dog along he would have loved it. This is near the ballpark, also a lot of very good bars and restaurants. A good place to consider on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: George H
Reviews.Content: I spend about 50% of my time traveling for business and I have to say the week that I spent in this hotel has been an absolute breath of fresh air. The people at here really love what they do!!! A few team members that truly stood out for delivering excellent service are: Darren- always smiling and extremely helpful. Dave- terrific service with check-in and great interactions with your guests Peyton- very pleasant and accommodating Buckeye- very energetic and happy, he obviously loves his job! Mike, Evan and Matt in F&B spot on with their service and all went out of their to make sure the group enjoyed their week. Alysandra (sp?)- with the valet service. No matter the time of day, she had a huge smile on her face and was happy to interact with any guest. I look forward to the next time that business brings me to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: gmg48_11
Reviews.Content: Our Board met at the Hotel Indigo in the Gaslamp Quarter in San Diego recently. Our rooms were large, bright and nicely furnished. The hotel restaurant food was very good and the staff at the front desk and the restaurant were especially helpful. There is a rooftop terrace bar, which has awesome views. An added feature is that it is a Green Hotel. We will definitely add this hotel to our list of return properties!

Reviews.Title: “Five star service!”
Reviews.Author: Micheladelfina80
Reviews.Content: We came to San Diego for a long weekend and this was my first time staying at an Indigo. It did not disappoint. The lobby was open and inviting, the room was wonderful (great view of the city, excellent lighting, open floor plan, comfortable bed and cozy decor) and the breakfast we had in the restaurant one morning was very good. Service at the desk was impeccable. Dave checked us in and was very informative and welcoming. He sent us to a great place for dinner and remembered us by name throughout the weekend. Darren was also a wealth of information, sending us to a great breakfast spot (the Mission, which was just around the corner) and offering ideas of places to visit. He checked in with us throughout our stay to see if there was anything the staff could do to make us more comfortable. Housekeeping staff was very friendly as well, and anything we requested was immediately attended to. The valet attendants were always quick to respond with our car and always asked how our day was. It was easy to see that the staff here enjoy their work and are proud to represent the product that they do. I would love to come back and visit again sometime and would choose the Indigo in a heartbeat. Their attention to details is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: manutd3
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed in 3 different hotels while in SD the last 3 times there. I will not need to look for another option next time. Stayed at the Indigo for a 4 day weekend with some friends the last week in April and what a great weekend we had and the indigo was a big part of it. The friendliest staff Ive ever met, the best location in downtown SD and just a great hotel in general. Clean, Comftorable, great location, great roof top and super friendly staff. Thanks for your hospitality guys, you will definitely see us again our next time in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific...truly pet friendly!”
Reviews.Author: V F
Reviews.Content: The staff here are the most friendly I have ever encountered: to my family, myself, and my dogs!! The location is great & the rooms are spacious & comfortable. We had a GREAT stay...thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: erchla
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a vacation to San Diego recently, and we have nothing but rave reviews. What a GREAT hotel with a friendly staff. Every time we walked through the lobby, someone kindly greeted us. The rooms were so nice and comfy. Lots of space. Clean rooms and bathroom. We loved the Keurig in our room. I personally enjoyed the Aveda products in the bathroom! Several comments on here mentioned the rooms were noisy, but we never had a problem with that. If you're planning a trip to San Diego, this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: Paige F
Reviews.Content: I could not say more about how wonderful the service was in every aspect of my stay. I never had to wait in line at the front desk for check-in or check-out or even to ask a question, they were always well staffed and willing to help. I was staying there for a meeting in town and had lots of meeting materials shipped to me there. The staff there was quick in bringing my boxes to my room and allowing me to check them in and out of the front desk as needed. They also helped me ship my boxes home and provided me with FedEx materials to do so. The bartenders were a great source of city knowledge and very attentive. While working early in the morning at the computers in the lounge I was brought a free cup of coffee by someone at the front desk, this made my day and gave this hotel a soft spot in my heart.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: aikisensei
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to a dozen or so restaurants as well as the baseball park. The room was pleasant, the bed nice and the staff very friendly. The hotel was also pet friendly as even the staff had their dogs with them. The shower however had absolutely no water pressure. All in all, a very nice hotel. I would definetely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: gkumarg
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location! It is in the Gaslamp quarter right next to all the restaurants and Petco park. There is a nice bar at the top from where you can see Padres play (at least the lights and crowd). The hotel staff is helpful and courteous. The room was nice and cozy with a very modern touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and rooms, not so good food”
Reviews.Author: JackSD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is bright, modern and playful -- and the rooms are comfortable and well-equipped (including wifi). Especially well-tuned is the cheerful, intelligent staff. For a pleasant place to stay in downtown San Diego, you can't go wrong with the Indigo as a less traditional and more personal experience. The downside factors result from an obvious decision to save costs on common services that are not immediately visible, for example: the breakfast experience. The hotel does not have a full service restaurant but blends a bar and tables into an attractive eating area. The problem is that the food is far beneath the quality of the hotel's physical and human appeal, below even the meager offerings of a downscale franchise chain. We're talking "croissants" that are limp and rubbery, one kind of bagels (egg) that are as hard as a rock, and no jams or preserves except for little plastic containers of Smucker's grape and mixed-fruit jelly. Except for the good coffee, the breakfast is strictly school cafeteria-quality. For a hotel that often charges over $250 a night for a room, this is really unacceptable. Other missing services are also noticeable, for example I found no place on site to buy sundries or newspapers (they tell you to go down the street to the 7/11 to do that), although copies of USA Today -- if that can be considered a newspaper -- are provided. If the Indigo corrects these problems, it'll inspire more repeat customers.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel for couples and a ball game!!”
Reviews.Author: dnjzagorski
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Short walk to Petco, good bars, and restaurants. Walking distance to seaport village. The hotel staff is very friendly and bar is great in the lobby. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Mojo-Ravi
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on other Trip Advisor reviews and, like so many of them, I was impressed. Staff was helpful with all the little things. Location was great with Petco Park and tons of restaurants nearby. Room was spacious, contemporary and comfortable. Will definitely stay here on my next San Diego trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property, Great Location, Trendy”
Reviews.Author: chadou23
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a very nice part of town. You are in walking distance of everything. I love the lobby and bar area... the windows open completely and you feel like you are outside. Rooms are very nice and comfy. Showers were incredible. Everything felt very new. I would stay here again. In fact I am, for 2 more weeks in May.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and experience”
Reviews.Author: SpaJumper
Reviews.Content: Used Hotwire and got an outstanding deal! Loved everything about this hotel. The location, the contemporary design, and the friendliness of the staff (not snooty). There is a Starbucks that is right around the corner. The parking is valet only and it's $38 which seems to be the going rate for 4* hotels in the Gaslamp (valet or self-parking). We had a great view of Petco Stadium and I loved the spacious shower, the Aveda products, and the bright decor. I would definitely recommend this place and would stay here again. I did read prior reviews that customer service went south once they realized the guest used Hotwire or Priceline but I was fortunate to not get that vibe at all. They treated us like any other guest.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: SgtWife
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, the staff very friendly and accommodating and the atmosphere was relaxed. We stayed for a weekend getaway with friends and felt like we had gone to a luxury hotel. The staff was very attentive and always had a smile. Although we didn't bring our dog, many people did and it is a very pet friendly hotel. With that said, there was no evidence of dogs other than seeing them in the lobby and at the bar. The rooms are well insulated as we never heard a dog or anything other than city sounds when our window was open. There is a nice rooftop bar with firepits and a view of Petco Park. There is a reflection pool (that some dogs would enjoy) and a grassy area just for your pet's needs. The room was spacious and if we needed anything the staff was there to fulfill our needs. The coffee maker in the room was nice but it would be better if there was more than one regular coffee pod and more condiments to accompany the coffee. There was however a choice of teas and decaf coffee. I am sure if we called the front desk they would have sent some up but we were eager to try the restaurant in the lobby. The food was attractively presented and very tasty. It was a wonderful stay and we would definitely stay there again. I must add that we felt very welcome which is not always the case with nicer hotels. Chris at the rooftop bar was very gracious and mixes a great drink and Matt at Table 509 was on top of his game with quick and friendly service. Even the valet staff was helpful with entertainment suggestions in town. A very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, worth every dime”
Reviews.Author: TrueBlueGin
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a group of friends March 10, 2012 for one night before departing on a cruise. From the time we arrived to the time we departed and even when we returned to stow our bags for the day before our return flight home, the service, hospitality and gracious welcome were outstanding. Sergio, the concierge/Service-Person-Extraordinaire arranged to have two cars take our group to dinner, and the next day when most of our group went to board the ship, my husband and I had to do some last minute shopping. Sergio arranged for a car to take us to the nearest mall, give us his number so when we were ready to go he would return to the hotel, grab our bags, come back to the mall, pick us up and take us directly to the cruise ship terminal. Amazing! We looked at many reviews on TA before booking this hotel, but in the end we chose it because several of the couples we were travelling with had already booked it. We are so glad we did! It was truly a lesson in getting what you paid for. Oh, and by the way, the bed was very comfortable, the view we had of the stadium was unreal, the temperature, sounds in the hotel (or the lack thereof), and toiletries were all above par. We briefly enjoyed the rooftop bar/lounge with great fireplace table and apparently a little strip of grass. I think it is even dog-friendly! (Check to be sure. I saw dogs, but not sure of the policy.)The location was ideal, within walking distance of several great looking restaurants; I could go on and on. This hotel made our trip on our first cruise the only place we will ever stay in San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: El_Viajero72
Reviews.Content: Hotel Indigo is a great choice if you want to be walking distance to Gaslamp's restaurants and shops and the Convention Center. It's away from the buzz of the main street, in a quiet street. The room I stayed was clean, with a nice, oversize bathroom. Free wifi is always a plus, but it was a bit slow at times. But the ethernet connection (also free) was fine. Staff were very friendly too. The rooftop pool/bar looked nice, but it was too cold when I stayed there. Only minor concern was the lack of a small cafe for a quick morning coffee and snack. Breakfast at the hotel's restaurant was a bit pricey and limited in selection.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service! Will definitely come back again!”
Reviews.Author: dino1228
Reviews.Content: Like others had already said, their service is unparalleled ;even I already knew their service is good, after staying I felt it's beyond my expectation. Every staff at front desk is extremely helpful; the deign of the hotel is kind of modern, bright, and comfortable. I could see Petco Park from my room although there was no game in March. Wifi is free. Though I did have some billing problem during my stay, Peyton and the manager Darren helped to fixed it as soon as possible. I also love their wake-up call. The only thing I didn't like is their breakfast: small in portion, taste is plain, and charge is a little bit high. Ask the front desk a 10% coupon for "Broken Yolk" which is 3 blocks away. Generally speaking it's a wonderful stay and I would definitely come back to this hotel if I need to visit San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “No attention to detail for a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geeta Y
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 days for a conference. It was rainy and cold the whole time and our heat didn't work. It took 2 days and asking 3 times to have the heat fixed. Also, the safe didn't work. That also took 3 requests and 2 days to get fixed. The same goes for the shower head. The room was otherwise nice, clean but quite noisy during the day. When we needed amenities, the hotel staff readily provided them. Finally, the gym — albeit it nice looking — didn't have much in the way of equipment or free weights. For the same price, I would instead try a larger, high-end, hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: Triflygirl91
Reviews.Content: I would like to commend your employees but in particular Sergio on making my trip to San Diego easy during a difficult time in my life. I travel for work on a weekly basis and at the moment I'm undergoing thyroid Cancer treatment that requires me to carry my own food due to diet restrictions. I can't eat anything that its been made already as I can't have any dairy, soy, fish or salt! I brought my "tasty food" with me and Sergio went above and beyond to help me heat up my food so I could eat. He will go to the employee break room, heat up food for me and bring it back to me. He put a smile on my face! What made me appreciate even more all he was doing for me was when he asked me if I needed silverware and I said I had some with me. He asked me if they were plastic ones and I said yes. His reply by saying that he would not allow me to use plastic that ai deserve real ones. So he went and got me a pair of silver wear wrapped in linen. That made my day. Little things that make you feel special, and he did. Your staff was amazing, your rooms are beautiful and clean and I just can't wait to come back. Please pass my appreciation to Sergio.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: McClung_12
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the SD half marathon and had a great time. We booked last minute on hotwire and were treated great. I made a couple of special requests that they accommodated and it made our stay very comfortable. I had read that third-party bookers were treated differently but did not find that to be the case in the very least. In fact the service was professional from the curb to the room. Sergio Navarro was exceptional! We left our very nice camera behind and he quickly reviewed security tape to find us and call us before we left town. I have accidentally left other electronics behind while traveling I have never seen anyone care as much, just a sincerely nice attitude. We went upstairs to the bar and you really could watch a ball game from up there with an unobstructed view of the entire field with the exception of the corner of right field. Great concept of a 'green' hotel that makes you feel good about supporting this type of hotel. Located close to the Park, good restaurants, and easy to get to, I look forward to coming again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: bmillio
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful and friendly. Clean, well-appointed room with a view of the green rooftop bar area. Really nice change from homogenous convention center hotels. If you like an urban, modern setting, this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in a lovely location”
Reviews.Author: una1982
Reviews.Content: This is a new, modern hotel in the trendy gaslamp district. Rooms are excellent, staff are really helpful. It has a small gym that has some weights and machines but it worth a visit. It appears to be pet friendly but there is no smell from the furry friends if you do not have one! It has a vibrant bar and I would advise anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Rogerfpowell
Reviews.Content: This place was a breath of fresh air to me. Beautiful lobby, friendly staff, perfect location!! The room was stunning, hardwood floors, awesome shower... Can't say enough good thing about it. h and a great bloody mary!!

Reviews.Title: “A Regrettable Mistake”
Reviews.Author: voyageurUSA
Reviews.Content: I very much regret booking this upcoming hotel reservation at Hotel Indigo, and am dreading my impending non-refundable stay. To say nothing of their reservations policies, I am appalled at at their price match guarantee policy, which provides this hotel chain with numerous loopholes. After booking my stay directly on Hotel Indigo's website, I found a rate that amounted to over $100 cheaper for the duration of reservation. I submitted the price adjustment request via their webpage which promises a response within 24 hours. Not only did I never receive any kind of response, calls to the hotel were met with requests that I call back at another time to catch a manager on duty, a reservationist who refused to take a message and pass it on to a manager, and when I finally did catch someone on duty, a response along the lines of "Well I'm sure you've referred to our webpage that lists all of the exceptions to this guarantee." Nice. Excellent customer service, guys. Even my credit card company was appalled at the level of customer service and the amount of time it took to get people on the phone. Never again will I stay at any hotels in this chain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel nice stay”
Reviews.Author: StubbyJo
Reviews.Content: Staff is very nice and friendly. Nice room. Purchased a view room and I guess it does not say what view is. We had views of the other buildings but not a big deal. We like the window open for air at night and it was rather noisy at night until about 2 a.m.. Sirens, people yelling. Could hear it with window closed as well, but it is a city! Great restaurants all around to walk to and we enjoy lots of walking so we explored all over. Staff nice although they did call me the day after we checked in to say they had us for 1 night only and our luggage was still in the room. I told her I would hope so since we had a 3 night stay. I had to tell her that more than once so I was getting annoyed. She said she found it but we had to have our cards reprogrammed. Got back to room and the maid left a note saying we had a "do not disturb" on door so she could not clean...we did not leave that on there. Wasn't a huge deal overall, just weird. I do agree about the coffee thing.ALthough the front desk did leave us 4 regular coffees when they had gone to see why our luggage was in the room but that was two cups each for the next morning. We did ask for more regular coffee rather than just one serving, but did not get it. We just went to Starbucks. Might stay there again although this was a pleasure trip and it is fun to try other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: ClaytonO
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely well presented and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was extremely spacious and had an awesome view being able to see into the ball park. The bed was large and comfortable and the room was clean. As a bonus the room had a complimentary Nespresso machine! The location was very convenient, only a few minutes walk to the downtown restaurants. The rooftop bar was also a great place to have a few drinks while the sun went down. Overall a very good hotel which I would not hesitate to go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, comfortable and classy”
Reviews.Author: Verinia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night on our way to Mexico. Very comfortable, chic hotel. Loved the decor, the luxurious beds, appreciated the tea and coffee making facilities, the safe in our room and an iron, as well as a huge powerful shower. the whole area was alive and bustling on a Friday night and although many of the bars were full we managed to find a lovely seafood restaurant a few blocks away. Would definitely stay here again if in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at Hotel Indigo”
Reviews.Author: glenns53
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Indigo as I called too late to reserve a room at the hotel where I attended a tax seminar. This was my good fortune. The hotel is located right down the street from Petco Park where the San Diego Padres play. It is next to the officical Gaslamp district which helps to avoid the noise though it is close enough to walk to the numerous restaurants, shops, bars, etc. It is also free of the street people you see closer to downtown San Diego. My room was of average size with a king bed. My priorities for a hotel room are: (1) ample hot water; (2) comfortable bed; (3) quiet. Hotel Indigo was excellent in the things that are important to me. I slept great every night after working out in the gym on the 9th floor. I might come back with my wife and have a nice dinner, catch a ball game and have a few drinks after the game. All of this within walking distance of Hotel Indigo.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and affordable elegance”
Reviews.Author: Kankead8
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a meeting that was at a hotel where I missed the cutoff (it drove the price well over $300). I decided to stay at Hotel Indigo, a chain where I have stayed before. Since the Hotel Indigo in Midtown Atlanta gives off such a nice vibe, I thought that San Diego's version should too. The convenience to the Gaslamp Quarter, and to my meeting were important, but so were the accommodations. The decor of the room was excellent, and the bed was comfortable. The workout facility was nicer than most, and had very little congestion. I am returning for another meeting in September, and I will reserve rooms for myself and my 10 person team when I return. The staff there was also very courteous, although I barely noticed them.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing noise”
Reviews.Author: SDFlipFlops
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Close to the gaslamp but far enough away to not hear the noise. But the noise from the air condition on the roof was far worse than any gaslamp noise. I asked about the noise after the first night. No one got back to me. After getting in late the second night we didn't stop and ask, so the next morning I asked again, The next night on our way back in I asked again, and was told what the problem was. By then we only had one night left and it wasn't worth changing rooms. Not that they offered a room change. I had read a review about the noise on tripadvisor but the review made it sound like it was the heating unit. So I thought it was room specific. This noise was top floors specific. We were on the 11th floor with another floor above us.The bed spread was made of some different material and was noisy and wouldn't stay on the bed too. It was a little spending for a Priority Hotel, but on the good side the hotel was very contemporary, the room was large, and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: YupiYey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was all that I expected. Excellent location (1 block away from petco park) Great staff, and a very comfortable bed. The rooms are spacious, with a great modern decor. And the free Internet is always appreciated. The parking fee is overpriced, but that didn't affect us as the park meters are not in service during the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Jessgriffith22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were excited to stay at the this hotel after reading the reviews and seeing the pictures online. When we checked in we were told that we had a room with 2 queen beds when our reservation was for a king. Not a huge deal but the guy was so rude about it. He said that the room situation "is what happens when you book through a third party" like it was some low class ridiculous way to book a hotel. He told us our only option was to upgrade for a view room which would cost us an extra 30 each day. So we take the the room they give us and there's someone's hair on the bed we didn't sleep on. Yuck. Also, the cleaning person didn't take our dirty glasses each day. Again not a huge deal but I felt we were paying for a nice hotel. Be prepared to pay for parking in this entire area. $38 per day!! At least we only paid for one night. We were comped a day since the valet lost our car keys and we had to change our plans since we couldn't leave the area. If you are there on a holiday you can use the meter parking overnight and save yourself some cAsh. The rooftop bar is nice and the service there was good. Also, not all of the front desk team was bad at service but we started off on the wrong foot with our first encounter.

Reviews.Title: “Quality at a great price”
Reviews.Author: James P
Reviews.Content: I read other comments before make my reservation, and I completely concur with the positive reviews. The location is great, within walking distance of just about everything in downtown. I walked from the Amtrak station (about 1 mile). There are dozens and dozens of places to eat within a 5-minute walk. I walked to the Convention Center (about .5 miles). The staff is friendly and relaxed. The hotel is clean and has no unpleasant odors. The room I stayed in was small, cheery, clean and comfortable. The large walk-in shower with a large shower head was much appreciated. I had a nice little breakfast served by a very friendly waiter. Did I mention that the price is great?

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Azzurri06
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Indigo. When we arrived and during our stay, we were not disappointed once. The lobby is very stylish and inviting, and the service was excellent. We were always greeted with friendly smiles by any of the staff members. Our room was wonderful! I love the wood floors, and everything was immaculate. I didn't see spots on the sheets or on the walls. Being so clean, I felt at home and comfortable immediately. There's free wifi in the room, so that was very helpful as I worked from the hotel. The hotel is located walking distance to many shops and restaurants. In fact, if you're in town during baseball season, you are 2 blocks from the stadium. There is a full service restaurant downstairs which we never ate at but we did visit a cafe about 3 blocks away called Cafe Chloe. What a gem! Definitely go there for lunch or breakfast. The food was great! They do server dinner as well but we didn't have dinner there. If you're looking for a massage or facial, Urban Calm, which is across from Cafe Chloe provides wonderful spa services. Enjoy your stay in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Decepticon75
Reviews.Content: wow. we stayed at the hotel indigo in san diego and absolutely loved it! you can't beat the location. you walk out the lobbys' front door, look to your left, and you're practically staring at petco park. the hotel is easily within walking distance of so many great places in the gaslamp district. and if you have a car, it's only a 5 minute drive onto the island of coronado (please make sure you go to the brunch at hotel del coronado!). the hotel room we had was really nice, with a REALLY comfortable bed. we had a beautiful walk-in shower complete with a teak seat. the hotel has all the amenities you would expect and they go out of their way to please you. i highly suggest this place if you're staying in the gaslamp district.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Terarl
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews that are too positive but I was so delighted with my stay at the Indigo hotel I thought that this would be a way to repay the great service I received from their staff. The hotel is super clean (rooms and lobby) and the staff is very friendly (checking in and out with a smile). We never visited the bar upstairs but the one in the lobby was friendly and the food was pretty good. The hotel is located close to all the action, so, there is a lot to do (try the Knotty Barrel down the street for a great beer). I wish I had some complaints but between the girls who checked us out to Darren's funny accent (I think Scottish) I had a great stay. The next time I roll into San Diego I will definitely stay at the Indigo.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: SpineyNorman
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel located a few blocks from the Gaslight District. It is sophisticated and well furnished. The staff are great and there is a good bar terrace on the ninth floor. I had few complaints. The valet parking is now $38 per night and it is in a rather 'seedy' area - check out the Heritage Hotel next door! Although not a criticism, it is a large hotel and does not have the intimate ambiance of other Indigos I have stayed in. We spent our evenings eating and drinking in the Gaslight District where there is lots of choice at all prices, although if you want to get into the top restaurants you will need to book on Friday and Saturday nights. We liked this hotel and will stay again when next in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Philippe_DC
Reviews.Content: Close enough to the gas lamp district, but not right in there. Great atmosphere. Made the mistake to try another hotel this year. Will go back to indigo next time if I can.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: BlanchePlanetEarth
Reviews.Content: We loved San Diego and Hotel Indigo. Everyone on staff was really polite and friendly, very helpful. the room had a fantastic view on the 10th floor. They are forward thinking in their welcoming of canine family members and even have a doggie pool and grass lawn on the 9th floor for pets to visit. The hotel was spotlessly clean. I will definitely return to Hotel Indigo.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ZMR
Reviews.Content: Was in San Diego for a short stay. Indigo is a great location in Gaslamp Quarter. Rooms are of a good size. Decor is tasteful. Simple, convenient and efficient. Will recommend

Reviews.Title: “My new "Go-To" Hotel in Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Bill K
Reviews.Content: Glad I found this hotel. Super clean, comfortable and modern and in one hec of a location in downtown San Diego. Not to mention very affordable. Our room was on the same floor as the rooftop bar / lounge that had an outdoor fire pit and we could look right down into the stadium where the Padres play. Super close to all the bars, restaurants, shopping and clubs in the Gas Lamp area. They supply free I-Pad's in the lobby for your personal use. Staff was super friendly and gave great advice, directions and had maps, menus and everything you need to make a selection on where to go. I found the staff to be super knowledgeable about the area. Only complaint is that the doors on the room were thin and I could hear people talking in the hallways at night. Nothing out of the norm from any other hotel I stayed at. I always bring a white noise machine to drown background noise out as I am a light sleeper. Noise did quiet down and I got a god nights sleep on comfortable bed. Room also had a great view of downtown and we had bonus water views and could see the air craft carriers in the distance. I have sent multiple parties to this hotel and they have all loved it. I work in the hospitality industry and can say that the Hotel Indigo in downtown San Diego is doing things right. See you there on my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: natalieharris79
Reviews.Content: Great location of the hotel. Nicely and fully furnished rooms. Big, king size bed and comfy to lean on. Very clean restroom and shower. Great customer service and friendly staffs. From the rooms you can see the view of Petco Park. Pricey but enough for the services they had provide to us. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons - just the facts”
Reviews.Author: Solo67_4
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Nicely decorated rooms 2. Comfortable beds and bed linens. 3. Friendly valet service 4. Easy access to I-5 and area attractions Cons: 1. Smarmy employees at check in (long lasting impression) 2. Expensive valet parking (usual for downtown)- do not recommend area parking lots!! 3. Horrible maid service (towels, toilet tissue and Kleenex NOT replaced, just a few of the many unpleasant experiences) 4. Bland, expensive food at the hotel restaurant 5. Lots of street noise. My room was on the 6th floor. 6. No fridge=more hassles than you can imagine I always walk into a motel/hotel with a positive mind set. My reviews are usually fair and positive. However I can not give this hotel a positive review. I frequent San Diego and will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “not on a 4 star tier.”
Reviews.Author: Mikebrez
Reviews.Content: I have to completely agree with last reviewer thats a platinum member. Its a 3.5 star hotel not a star. In this district you will have several hotels that are 4 star to choose from. The hotel is located a little out of the way to be considered gaslamp, but walkable. Bar and restaurant really regular hotel standard. service is good, i like the hotel runs on mac everything. rooms are not huge, but decent would be a great hotel for around 100.00 a night off peak.

Reviews.Title: “Really cool hotel with some local flare”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler1979
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for a week with a group of people. The bar and restaurant are awesome and they even open the huge windows so it feels like you're outside on a beautiful day. The murals and decor of the hotel are clean and fresh, really up to date. The front desk staff and bell staff would all say, 'Welcome back' when you walk through the entrance...it was really amazing that they remembered who were guests of the hotel and who were local friends of the guests! The rooms are so clean with the hardwood floors and I'm obsessed with their keurig coffee makers!! It's also a great location with tons of shopping and cool local restaurants within walking distance. This is a great hotel and we'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not four stars”
Reviews.Author: PVBRANDY
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated 3.5 stars and as long as you manage your expectations, you will not be disappointed. The room was average size and comfortable, although nothing special about the bed or linens. The bathroom is larger than average and very nice, including a large walk in shower. Aveda products are a nice touch. Housekeeping did not fully replenish towels, toiletries or coffee one day, but once the front desk was called it was taken care of reasonably fast. The restaurant and bar are not memorable. Breakfast selections were limited and the food was mediocre. There are far better choices an easy walk from the hotel. The bartender served a martini with crushed ice floating in it. Although I am a platinum card holder for the chain, the front desk only noticed it in the reservation after I pointed it out and we were given an upgraded room, which as best I can tell simply meant a higher floor. The free high wireless internet was a very nice touch. Upon departure for the airport, the door man put is in a non-metered taxi. He told us the fare would be the same, but when we arrived at the airport the driver told us the fare was higher. Not a big deal, just not appropriate. In general the staff are pleasant and the rooms are fine, and appropriately rated 3.5 stars. Cheaper four star rooms were available in the area for the time we visited, so we were slightly diappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Gaslamp Quarter...great location. Need to work out a few kinks.”
Reviews.Author: LBC1979
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with a great central location in the Gaslamp Quarter. The room was great. Hardwood floors, big closet, nice view, big bathroom, comfortable and clean. The staff was also friendly. However, as I've found at a number of trendy hotels, many lack the service and amenities to justify the expense. A few irritating things: constant problems with the hotel keys not allowing us access to our floor from the elevator, waiting an hour for room service only to find out when I called to check on the order that they "are out of that, someone should have called", $48 overnight parking, etc. Overall, still a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed one wonderful night”
Reviews.Author: deener07
Reviews.Content: loved this hotel, staff was friendly and it was a nice treat to get to visit with the dogs at the front desk; After 10 days travelling, and being away from our pets was nice to visit with cute friendly pups. the hotel its self was decorated and designed very nicely. the lobby restaurant was awesome, great food. Rooms were very neatly layed out, super clean and spacious. View was amazing. only complaint we had was the valet parking was 35$... no self parking.

Reviews.Title: “Location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Rienhart
Reviews.Content: A quiet location a few blocks from the gas lamp with a wonderful front desk staff made for a pleasant two night stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great rest”
Reviews.Author: Foodster1
Reviews.Content: Great location with several great restaurants near by....hotel was different then most which I stay in...which is every week....nice view, staff was friendly, room was quiet. Room layout was not your normal square box.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of the Gas lamp district. Easy 10 minute drive from the airport. Front desk staff are some of the nicest I've ever seen, valet parking was easy, attendants were extremely nice. I was upgraded to a suite. This room is about 600 square feet, great view of the ball park. Fairly quiet but close enough to the airport you still hear some planes. The lobby area is very lively but kind of noisy. There is a great outdoor patio bar on the 9th floor that has incredible views of the area. Easy walk to many colorful local joints and a very typical Starbucks around the corner. This would be one of my first choices for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “We had a pleasant stay here”
Reviews.Author: megria
Reviews.Content: The "boutique" definition is a little more substantial than some competitors that employ the styling more superficially just to be able to use the adjective. It's not luxurious, but it has some panache and doesn't disappoint relative to pictures on the website. The rooms have wood floors, a nice touch. Ours had a curved wall at the closet, breaking up the usual rectangular hotel room monotony. Colors and wall patterns are warm and agreeable. The same goes for the hallways, which gives a welcoming and comforting feel to arriving at one's room. Views can be good. The bathroom is spacious, functional and attractive. Beds are OK, nothing special, which, unfortunately, is the norm in lots of, but not all, hotels. There's no refrigerator or microwave. I think it's $10 a night for the frig; I don't know about a microwave. That's too much for such a simple convenience and was probably the thing I felt least positive about during our stay. To be able to store a few snacks that require refrigeration isn't much to ask. At least internet usage is free. You have a choice of either wifi or ethernet. The lobby is welcoming and bright, casual with character. A couple of iPads and iMacs (running Windows, oddly) are available for use. There's an adequate 24 hour exercise room and a pleasant 9th floor terrace overlooking Petco Park. There's not a pool, which was fine on pleasant, but not hot December days. But I could see where some would find this to be a shortcoming. The staff is helpful, pleasant and professional. I'm fine with saving energy and expenses by not providing new towels, toiletries and such every day, but I'd say that room cleaning could have been a bit more thorough. A couple times, we'd been to the beach and tracked a bit of sand into the room, nothing at all extreme, but it was there. It would have been nice had it been swept or vacuumed more carefully. Not to overstate it, though. The room was sufficiently clean. The Gaslamp District is touristy to the point where we didn't bother with it, but even for those taking advantage, I'd think being just outside it, as this hotel is, is a big plus for avoiding excess street noise. It's not exactly quiet, but for an urban location, it's not bad. I like the East Village location, surrounded by condos. It feels a little like living there because of that. The nearby and underrated ballpark gives great ambience as it dominates the neighborhood with a sort of mythic presence and easy views into the stadium. It's minutes away from Balboa Park by car and a walk to the harbor. Some nice SD neighborhoods (South Park, North Park, Hillcrest) surround Balboa Park and having them so close is great for restaurants, cafes and walking around. Other in town beach areas aren't that far, either. The light rail is just a couple blocks away. Valet parking is expensive (though the valets are great), but there are some good alternatives. On some nights, street parking is easy. A couple of nearby lots are $5 for 10 hours on weekdays/nights, $10 on weekends. There are other lots, too. Careful, though — on the street, the police will ticket you if you give them the chance. All in all, we had a very nice stay here. It's a fine, if not extraordinary hotel and I'd stay there again if I were looking to be in the downtown San Diego area. Please give us a small refrigerator next time, though.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: Adelaide5000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms are okay without being luxurious. The things that let them down were breakfast - very average and we had to ask twice for our orange juice, plus we had to ask where our laundry was more than 24 hours after they had taken it. Given the price of the laundry this should not have needed follow up. Finally, there seemed to be a high number of people who had room service breakfast on our floor, and their trays were left in the corridor for hours and hours, which resulted in a nasty smell. The staff on reception, concierge, housekeeping and valet were all extremely friendly and helpful. Probably wouldn't stay here again, but it was okay.

Reviews.Title: “People & Dog friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stewart F
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Indigo. Staff were very friendly and went out of their way to help. I would highly recommend this hotel. Location: You can see the Padres baseball stadium from the hotel. A few blocks from Horton Plaza shops. Some nice restaurants and bars close by the hotel. Room & Décor: Clean and modern design. Good shower, no bath. Other: Dog friendly hotel. They have pictures of some of the dogs that have stayed on the iPad on the reception desk. And one of a goat!! A nice feature. Internet is free. Valet Parking $35 PCs in the lobby for guests to use. Recommendations: The Mission Café : 1250 J Street. Great for breakfast and lunch. Great food, large portions and reasonably priced. Can be a wait due to its popularity. Lolitas at the Park : 202 Park Blvd. Great Mexican fast food.

Reviews.Title: “New years eve 2012”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl201042
Reviews.Content: It is a beautiful hotel, but does NOT have a pool, the rooms do not have bath tabs (apart from the suits) and the terrace lounge is small and dull. Even though the staff is friendly, we requested a bed for our pet several hours ago and are still waiting. Also, most hotels serve champagne for new years eve, but not this one!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Marconap
Reviews.Content: Nice boutique hotel in the gaslamp quarter, close to everything. We walked everywhere, parking a little expensive but it is the average in downtown San Diego. Nice terrace overlooking the baseball field.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, Helpful,Gratious, Desk Management!”
Reviews.Author: Fjeldbar
Reviews.Content: We were here for a weekend over Christmas. Very modern and clean hotel. We had an emergency which required us. To extend and have some extra attention. The desk managers on all shifts were very accommodating. I love Indigo properties as a rule , but this one is the top!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary but not Pretentious”
Reviews.Author: dsandi
Reviews.Content: Chic hotel without self important staff or trying-to-hard fussy environment. LOVED the pergo/wood floors in guest rooms!! Great great idea. Exceedingly clean throughout. The colors and unique furnishings in the rooms are great. I will absolutely stay here again. There is only valet parking (expensive) but that is typical of city hotels. Safe and convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: njbecky126
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights over Christmas...the hotel is very nice. They put me in room 202 which was a handicap-accessible room on the second floor (202), possibly because I prepaid using a discount rewards program. It was fine for what I paid (about $100 a night), but if I had booked directly with the hotel I would have requested a room change. The room was very large and in wonderful condition. Three minor points: there was a pipe that made a clicking noise in the heating vent in the bathroom which was annoying, but by closing the bathroom door I was not disturbed by it. The hot water turned lukewarm on 3 of the 5 mornings I used the shower at around 8 a.m. Third, room 202 is above then kitchen so I could smell breakfast cooking in the morning and steak and burgers at night. If this is a turn-off, make sure you are not assigned room 202. The bed was extremely comfortable. Free wifi. Window in the room opens for fresh air which is also nice. Large closet for all my stuff. I ate in the hotel dining room one morning for breakfast and it was ok. The scrambled eggs with spinach were good but the potatoes were cold. With coffee and tip it was nearly $20. The rest of my stay I ate around the corner at Brooklyn Bagels & Bialys which I recommend for the best bagels in San Diego. They make a variety of sandwiches and with coffee it was usually around $8. Service was very fast and friendly. There are a couple of other bars and restaurants within 1-2 blocks of the hotel; a Thai place, a bar/restaurant/bowling alley, Basic pizza (very good!), Smash Burger, a 7-eleven one block toward the baseball stadium, and a CVS on Market ST and 6th? There is a Starbucks two blocks away too if you require one. The neighborhood is called East Village and it is about 3 blocks from the Gaslamp District. I liked being far away from the madness of Gaslamp but close enough to walk there anytime, even evening. The closest trolly stop is on Market and Park, another 3 block walk. The further east you walk (toward the trolley stop) the sketchier the neighborhood becomes, but I had no problems. I probably would not walk off Market street alone a late at night in that area by the trolley. There are a lot of homeless people in San Diego; and many are in this area too. However I was never bothered by anyone; no one even asked for a handout. There is always police presence at the Market and Park trolley stop. I did not have a car and used public transportation to get to the zoo, La Jolla, Old Town, Harbor Island for a whale watch trip. You can buy an all-day pass (includes trolley and local bus service) for $5. A great buy as the taxis are a bit high. I did take one early in the morning to go from the hotel to the Sheraton on Harbor Island Drive (3 miles) and it was $16 and a 10 minute ride. Took the bus back for $2.25. Seaport Village is within walking distance, 10 blocks directly east toward the harbor. You can literally see the Petco Stadium from the hotel. It's 2 blocks away. I pre-booked with SuperShuttle online and had airport to hotel (and return) shuttle service for $16 round trip. A great bargain and painless. Shuttle was waiting for me at the airport after I got my luggage. Overall, a good stay and I would return to the Hotel Indigo again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: strux
Reviews.Content: We got an incredible last-minute rate at the Indigo Hotel, but I'd definitely stay here on another occasion (even without the discount.) The hotel was impeccably clean, with a beautiful, modern look. The room was quite large and had a nice view of the downtown skyline. I only wish I'd had more time to enjoy the amenities!

Reviews.Title: “Will not be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: karla h
Reviews.Content: First I would like to thank the only two people that made my stay somewhat decent. Cree your amazing your customer service is outstanding and your attitude is awesome. Thank you so much. To the bellhop who showed us the rooms we thank you for your opinion and the compassion you showed. Unfortunately I do not recall your name but I do remember you saying you had twin girls. Thanks again you both deserve praise for your hard work!! Second: let's address the bad. Chris if you do not know what your doing ask someone who does. He told me a certain amount of money was going on my card and then charged the entire upgrade fee to this card folded up the receipt and said have a great day. I walked out looked at the receipt and he charged the full amount to this card. I went back in asked why he did that and I got the deer in the headlight stare. Third: I stayed here because it was assigned as a low rate on a third party website. Well the room was too small for my family we asked for a larger room the request was granted for 60 additional per night we were fine with that because we were going to eat up the cost we paid and stay elsewhere. Well we should have stayed elsewhere. On my second day there I get a call from my credit card company saying they detected fraud on my card because of three different authorizations of which I was not aware of I let them know I was staying there but that did not matter so I currently have a lock on my account until I provide the cc company with receipts. The hotel charges 75 for each day you are there and on one night they charged me 13 dollars and no one had an explanation as to why it was done. I asked on more than one occasion to speak to the hotel manager with no response he either was not in or could not be found. I also requested that he phone me on my cell also with no response.The last night we were there I walked into my room which had not been thoroughly cleaned a dust pan was left on my living room table and apparently the maid broke something in our room because my one year old daughter picked up a large piece of glass and handed it to my husband. (pics below) Long story short we will not be back. I'm the director of my airlines hotel committee and this hotel just lost out on new business. This hotel is NOT for families no refrigerator, no microwave,no pool. Stay Away!!

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mwall722
Reviews.Content: This was one of my favorite hotels that I stayed in this year, which is saying a lot with over 12 countries visited!! However there were a couple small things that kept it from the 5-star review. Let me begin by saying overall this hotel is great. Upon arriving, we were upgraded to a nicer room for joining the rewards program. The front desk staff was very accommodating. The room was very nice with modern furnishings, comfortable beds, spacious bathroom, and a nice westward view. The flat screen HDTV was also a nice bonus. We only had a few problems, which were very minor but added up to annoyances. For example, one night one of us had a craving for a chocolate chip cookie and we were elated to see in the hotel info card in our room that room service was available 24hr AND they had CC cookies!! Imagine our disappointment when we called and were curtly told that room service was not available until 6AM :( Another very picky point, was the complimentary coffee, which was awesome that we had our very own Keurig coffeemaker in the room, but there was only one caffeinated coffee packet (in addition to 2 teas and a decaff coffee packet). The staff was happy to bring up a couple extra caf. coffee packets when we called though, however the next day we had the same situation. Yes, I know, this is EXTREMELY minor, it's free coffee! Lastly, we looked forward to enjoying a drink at the hotel terrace bar before we left for the airport, but it was closed (as it was one night earlier) even though it was an hour after the advertised opening time. So instead we grabbed a drink at the first floor hotel bar which was nice (decent happy hour) but not the same as enjoying the San Diego skyline while sitting around a roof-top fire. Also the location is great, just blocks from 5th street, which is filled with great bars and restaurants. Also close to public transit stops if that's your thing. I would definitely recommend this place to friends, however it would be even better if the above problems were rectified.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service without the fuss”
Reviews.Author: brandychocolate
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel Indigo, whilst at a conference in SD. A little boutique hotel, with attention to detail, great service and tasty food without the hyperbole and stiffness of most 4 star hotels. The rooms are luxurious, elegantly designed, spacious with a home like feel. Centrally located witin walking distance to gaslamp, convention etc. All staff are very helpful with a smile in their face I would not think twice about choosing indigo whilst in SD.

Reviews.Title: “A very design place close to the convention center”
Reviews.Author: Mario O
Reviews.Content: I attended recently a medical meeting in San Diego, California and I was extremely impressed by this hotel. Modern and elegant, fine in its decoration, calm and very well situated, just five to ten minutes walking time from the convention center. The room where I stayed was large, clean and furnished with modern and high-quality materials. The hotel staff was particularly kind and very professional. A nice place I do recommend !

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Greg L
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was excellent. They are exceptionally pet-friendly. In fact, Sergio went out of his way to give our dog some special attention. And, took the time to show us a special pet "relief" grass area on the 9th floor patio. The hotel itself is very modern, clean, and "green." It's in an excellent location. For the level of service we received, the condition of the property, and pet-friendly policy, I would have expected to pay a LOT more. I would recommend this hotel/location to anyone! (A special thanks to Sergio, Darren, and all the friendly staff!!!).

Reviews.Title: “Super cute - loved the vibe!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hdfab
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a pleasant experience to stay at!! Its a very boutique-y hotel and I absolutely loved the room decor! We had a handicap accessible room so the shower was big although the shower head could have been a little better. And the counter at the sink wasn't very big to hold ur stuff. Other than that the bed was comfortable and the pillows were great! Our room had a Kurig coffee maker and iPod dock but our wasnt working just right , luckily we brought our own! The bar downstairs and lobby was very cute but we never made it to the terrace bar. The staff was very friendly as well. I was concerned we may have been too many blocks over to be in a good part of the city but it was actually perfect!!! Would definitely stay again and again!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Fees!”
Reviews.Author: nessawang
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here just two weeks ago to celebrate his birthday. We had issues, specifically with their service. First, upon check-in, we were informed that our room wasn't ready, so they told us to wait in the lobby and they would come get us when ready (this was around 2:15pm). By 3pm (check-in time), the same rep still didn't grab us and continued to check in other people. (We were very close to the front desk, by their computer area). So we went to check in again, and of course the room was ready. No big deal - everyone has an off day and it gets busy! We sprung for their suite, which was very spacious. The rooms are indeed very nice, and I had very high expectations for this hotel considering it's high rating on several websites. Unfortunately, they have charged us a $300 "smoking" fee, claiming there was evidence of smoking in the room. We booked this hotel SPECIFICALLY because it was an entirely non-smoking hotel and I have allergies. I left a voicemail with management and am wondering what sort of "evidence" they could have found. I'm anxious to hear back but if it isn't reversed, I will have no choice but to dispute this with my credit card company. What a headache. So needless to say, beware!!!

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding service, great room, great terrace, decent food, great shower, 24-hour fitness room, no pool.”
Reviews.Author: pkpdjh
Reviews.Content: Whatever this place does to train their employees in customer service, every hotel should copy. Starting with Payton (sp?) at the front desk, every person we dealt with was outstanding. When a couple people are that way, you figure that it's a fluke. We dealt with at least six different people and they were all outstanding. The room was really nice. It was more artistically laid out and finished than most hotels and it really made it feel like home not a stock hotel. The bathroom was beautiful and the shower was big enough to film a porno. The terrace on the top of the hotel was beautiful and had a nice bar, again with a wonderfully helpful barmaid. We ate at the restuarant for dinner just because we liked the hotel so much and it was empty, quiet and beautiful. Overall, I'd give the food four stars. My wife's squash ravioli (with braised short ribs and chevril cream sauce) was 5-stars, though. My swordfish was great, too. It was all a little pricey though. The terrace overlooks Petco park and you can actually see a lot of the diamond. The only downer was the heater had some noisy vibration, but I assume they fixed that. I can't imagine that was normal. It's a great location down the road from Cafe Chloe and Vennissimo cheeses, two of our favorites. If you are looking for a romantic weekend and don't need a pool this place is perfect. The fitness center is open all hours and there is a meditation terrace that looks nice.

Reviews.Title: “The noisiest hotel on earth”
Reviews.Author: weluvusa
Reviews.Content: After a 11 hour flight all we wanted to do was go to sleep. A straight forwardvrequest for an expensive hotel you would reckon ? The first 2 room we had were next to ice machines that were powered by merlin engines and the bed in the room next to it vibrated. Our only choice was to upgrade, which we only found out later was to upgrade the view. This room was on the top floor but we were kept awake all night by music form the bars and traffic noise. The windows might as well have no glass in them. There is also a bar terrace halfway up the building just to make sure you cannot escape from the noise. If you dont plan to sleep in the room then this is a perfect hotel as it is clean and modern, next to petco, etc, etc. The staff are well aware of the noise issues and have excuses to the ready. Pity i prepaid via trivago otherwise inwould have left straight away. Try omni or the marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gerald S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here Nov.5-19/2011 and had a great stay here. The front desk staff were friendly and very helpful. The room was comfortable. The in-hotel restaurant served up delicious food with portions that were just right (no belly busting breakfasts here). The ninth floor lounge/terrace was a nice place to relax day or night. We lucked out one evening when they had a Canine Cocktail night where people brought their dogs up to the lounge (pet-friendly hotel). We were able to walk or take transit to whatever we wanted to see. There is a trolley stop about 3 very short blocks away which made getting around a breeze. There are many restaurants close by. Overall big thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “the extra block is worth it”
Reviews.Author: Michelle N
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Hotel Indigo for the ASHA convention. This was not one of the listed hotels by the convention organizers, but I'm glad Expedia recommended it. It was more cost effective and only a block outside of the area where the preferred hotels were located. In fact, the extra block made is nicer b/c there was less activity/less stress= more relaxing! Cleanliness and service were superb! Food, room service, technology, etc!!! Hopefully, will be able to visit again sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place in the middle of the city!”
Reviews.Author: LeslieIdaho_USA
Reviews.Content: Just left the Indigo and needed to share our experience. We love the cool modern vibe. This is a great place to be near the action of Market street and great restaurants. Everything is within walking distance. The 9th floor terrace with cozy fireplaces and beautiful views was one of our favorites things. We were upgraded to a Jr Suite on the 11th floor with huge corner views of Petco because of our Platinum status with Priority Club. Thanks to the staff for the awesome upgrade! Valet staff hustled and were very polite. Parking is expensive but that's the way it is downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good blend of location, cost and value”
Reviews.Author: LatinDrummer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times. This hotel's proximity to Gas Lamp, it's comfortable modern rooms and great roof top bar make this an ideal choice for a stay in downtown San Diego. Though this hotel is part of the the IHG group of hotels it feels like a boutique hotel. Parking is a little pricy and the hotel only offers valet but parking is expensive anywhere downtown when you stay. You can walk to the local baseball stadium, Seaport Village and attractions along the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Modern decor, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: itsamitsingh
Reviews.Content: I knew I had landed a steal on Hotwire, the moment I checked into my room.Pretty modern decor,amazing rooms with amenities that one won't find even in much more expensive hotels. The service was great, one of the Bell Boys even bought me a universal charger from a not so closeby electronics store. I used the gym every morning, and being on one of the higher floors, the "View from the Treadmill" was indeed quite unique. The hotel is located in the heart of Gaslamp district, and there are some decent Mexican,Chinese, Thai & Indian options available within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GZMOA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel in the halloween time. The location is absolutely perfect for club/bar hopping,just in the heart of gaslamp. he rooms are trendy with a modern design+clean. The fornt desk staff are very polite and helpfull. If I got to sand iego back, I definitely stay at this hotel. The disadvantage is the expensive parking price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: vin1961
Reviews.Content: Spent 2nice nights here in early November. Hotel is in a good location, within walking distance of the many bars and restaurants in the gas lamp area. Modern rooms are good, although soundproofing is not good. Having said that, we were not disturbed at all through the night. The 9th floor bar is great, with good views of the city. Breakfast was both nice and good value for a lage hotel. Would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Something for Every Kind of Traveler”
Reviews.Author: siburrgary
Reviews.Content: Nice, very modern rooms. Located at edge of Gaslamp, so close without all the extra crowd noise. Super friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAFF!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny F
Reviews.Content: I didn't actually stay at this hotel, but had passed by on Halloween night to see if myself and 3 others could call a cab from the valet station. Not only did the sweet lady (I can't remember her name for the life of me) at the station try and call us a cab (it was a busy night for cabs), but she ended up calling a friend of hers who owned a limo company to take us back to our house. (going the extra mile) While we were waiting for the limo, Darren the Rooms Manager, (again, I think this was his name...it was late. he's from Scottland), brought us all a bottle of water and asked if we needed anything else. We ended up talking with him for a while about the hotel and he was very kind and informative. I am a meeting planner in Nashville, Tennessee, which has a Hotel Indigo and will ALWAYS highly recommend this hotel based on my experience in San Diego. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy location”
Reviews.Author: Kelsey1976
Reviews.Content: Not the hotel's fault that we were there during Halloween. If you are into Halloween, San Diego is party central! But it is so noisy until the bars close down at 2am. Our fan didn't work in the room, so in order to get air circulating we had to have the window open a crack. When we asked to move to another room, they were quite certain that this was not possible. One visit to the front desk, and 2 phone calls and they were finally clear that we wanted another room. They just couldn't move us immediately, which we understood--but we wanted to sleep in another room the next night. I suggested that they store our luggage until another room was open, and they finally decided that was possible. When we got back from the wedding reception that night, we did have another room! They said our luggage would be in our room, but it was not. Another call to the front desk, and it was delivered. The hotel website and the literature says daily newspaper. When we asked about this, we discovered daily to them means Mon-Fri not on the weekends. They don't have towel racks in the room! For a green hotel, that does not want to wash your towels everyday, it is hard to have dry towels, if you can not hang them up. They do have hooks, but only 2, one for a hand towel, and one for a bath towel. And there were 2 of us in the room. They only gave us one package of coffee, it seems as if they are set up just for single people staying in the room. We had to request more coffee. Parking is $35, which is quite steep. Normally we would have just parked on the street, but with the wild party going on, we decided it was best to do valet. All in all, I don't think that we would stay here again. But we admired how calm and professional the front desk staff was considering downtown was going bonkers with all of the Halloween parties.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique business & leisure hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterFoxy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Indigo for 5 nights in October and had a great time. The hotel is very modern and has a nice welcoming open reception with free internet PC's, ipads, valet and a bar with large open-wall windows. If you're lucky you might meet one of the hotel dogs in reception, very cute. Our room was also modern with tea/coffee, flatscreen etc. Pretty much all of your requests can be handled by the friendly and helpful staff and the hotel is perfectly positioned for the nearby lively gaslamp quarter but in a quieter part of the East Village. See reception for great local bar and restaurant recommendations from breakfast to dinner. The roof terrace bar is also very nice with fire pits and glimpses of the local Padres stadium but there were no games whilst we were there. I would recommend this hotel for any short breaks in SD!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: jsolt
Reviews.Content: We found the Indigo is an excellent place in the heart of San Diego. Brand new stylish rooms and decor, far away from the usual, nice staff, attractive views on higher floors and from the bar on the 9th floor makes the hotel our favourite in SD. WLAN is free, as well the use of computer and printer in the lobby, so that's another plus. However, valet parking is 35.- $ a day. Could be avoided by using public parking for about 10.- $ a day, but no in and out privileges. if important, the hotel has no pool but an attractice fitness room. Will be back whenever in SD!

Reviews.Title: “The place to be”
Reviews.Author: colemanv
Reviews.Content: I just return from a five night stay at the Indigo Hotel. I arrived early and the room was not ready. The young lady at the front desk (Cree) was very professional and courteous. She suggested several options for us to occupy our time until the room was ready. The hotel was clean and in a great location. It was in walking distance to the convention center, seaport village, the heart of the gaslamp district (5th street), and mall. The rooms were clean and well appointed. The only negative I have is that the maid service was slow. Our room was never ready before 5pm. After being at the convention center all day to return and the room not be cleaned got old real quick! Other than that, everything was perfect. The gym, relaxation room and outside bar are all on the 9th floor and were a welcomed treat. Internet service is free and the have two computers in the lobby for guest use. The restaurant food was pretty tasty also. The whole staff was very friendly and helpful with information about the area. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jenny0401
Reviews.Content: My husband and I staed at this hotel in August for 4 nights. We found the hotel to be modern , quite new and is in a good location for sightseeing and for restaurants. We had a Kind Bed View room which was spacious, modern, clean and ver comfortable. We had a corner room on the 7th floor with a direct view of Petco Park. The room had good airconditioning, large tv, writing desk, an excellent bathroom with large shower and good water pressure. The king bed was very comfortable with numerous pillows, which I found to be too soft. In saying that, I found all pillows in the US to be the same. Breakfast was included in the room rate, available on the ground floor in the bar area. The menu was limited to a variety of eggs, fruit and juices. You nearly always get a side of toast and potatoes - potatoes I find a bit strange for breakfast!!. The breakfast is covered by a coupon to the value of $20.00 so it depends on your selection as to whether you pay extra. We found this happens alot in hotels across the US. The staff were friendly, the free internet ivia 2 new computers in the lobby was welcomed. The bar served good drinks for our night caps and also some food (limited menu) for those late hunger pains. There is also a roof top bar so when the baseball is on, you can sit up nthere and watch the game. Drinks are not served in glasses, but in plastic cups, whcih I do not like to drink my wine out of plastic. The reason behind this is some guetsts of the hotel decieded it would be fun to throw their glasses over the balaconey to the street below, where neighbours complained. The hotel was close to the tram to take you to the old town (approx an hours trip). There are some good restaurants in the area. I would dfeinately recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations, but pretty good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mtishome
