Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a pretty good place to stay in San Diego. Here are our notes by category: Location: we loved the location. It was right on the edge of the Gas Lamp District, so out of the fray and hectic environment of the District, but close enough to access all of the things to do there. Amenities: the gym is awesome. Perfect amount of equipment and when we went (mid-October), there was always equipment available to use. They have Life Fitness equipment, which is a great brand. There are two TVs and it can get a little loud with the acoustics in the room, but overall, we were very pleased with the gym. We had coffee/tea in the room, which we enjoyed. Free wireless was a plus, but we didn't use it very often b/c we were out all of the time. The iHome clock radio was nice as we did plug in our iPod. Overall, the amenities were just right. Restaurant/bar: not impressed with the food quality or service. It's not that it was bad, but we expected a little better after reading that the hotel supports local fare. With all of the other dining options, we forewent the convenience of the hotel for any meal and ventured out on the town. There is an outside bar on the 9th floor, but we didn't spend any time there outside of doing a brief walk through. Room cleanliness: the room was very clean. Having hardwoods, especially in a hotel that allows pets, was a plus from the cleanliness factor, but we heard our neighbor early every morning as she walked around her room in her high heels. There were a few items missing when we checked in (no bath/shower mat, missing coffee/tea and mug), but they brought them the next morning when they cleaned the room. The housekeeping staff was pleasant. Overall, the rooms were clean (which I would expect no less) and we would give them a middle of the road on comfort b/c of the noise from the hardwoods and it feeling a little more industrial than we're used to. Staff: this is where we felt the hotel fell short. The bellman was nice and asked us lots of questions (where we went that day, how our stay was, etc.). But, the front desk staff was not as personable. It was not that they said/did anything wrong, but they just weren't as friendly as we had read about in reviews. We had handful of requests during our stay at the hotel and they were slower to respond and did not follow up. If I had not read the reviews about the staff being so wonderful before we came, our expectations would have been lower and it would have been normal, run of the mill hotel staff. But, we had higher expectations, which we felt were not met. Again, it's not that they did anything wrong, they just weren't what we expected after reading the reviews. Overall, we would recommend the hotel with some reservations. If you are looking for more upscale, plush rooms (like the US Grant), this is not your place. It seems best fit for younger (30's and 40's), more mover/shaker adults. Not a place for kids or families.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for business and to rest/entertainment”
Reviews.Author: decon11
Reviews.Content: Was in San Diego for conference. Stayed at the Indigo and walked to the conference. Very convenient to convention center, Gaslamp entertainment and the ballpark. Easy to airport and to freeways. Hotel seems new, very clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at a surprising value”
Reviews.Author: mattr789
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Indigo for two nights as part of a solo vacation to Southern California. The staff here was great: incredibly helpful, professional, and welcoming. I loved the decor of the place, from lobby to guest rooms to the roof--everything was unique but comfortable. I was surprised by how nice the hotel gym was (more than just a treadmill, and with a view looking out to the city) and by the hotel's great internet--it was speedy, easy to connect, and free! The rooftop bar was a great place to relax at the end of the day, with great views and a very comfortable atmosphere. As far as location, I didn't do much in the Gaslamp, but instead used my car to go to the Zoo, Coronado, Hillcrest, and La Jolla. The valet was fast and attentive, and traveling around wasn't a problem with the hotel's location. Also, it was not a far run to get to Balboa Park for some trail running. (Two other perks about the location were the Knotty Barrel Bar and Gastropub on the corner, and a Starbucks one block over.) I got a great pre-paid rate on the room, making the value of the my stay an incredible deal given the quality of the hotel. Overall, I would definitely recommend the Indigo, and hope to stay at another Indigo sometime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Its All Good”
Reviews.Author: jcborange
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay near the gaslamp downtown. From check in , to housekeeping, to bar staff everyone is very friendly and helpful. If you have a pet, this is the place. The hotel treats your pet like royalty. The hotel has an area on the 9th floor where you can enjoy a drink while your pet does its business. The hotel is of very modern architecture. Its fits in with all the new development in the East Village Area of San Diego. The only knock is the $35 daily parking. However, this is the going rate for hotels downtown. We parked our car in a parking garage on 6th & K for half the price. There is 24 hour security. We will definitely stay here again downtown & with a pet.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel kinda sucks but looks cool”
Reviews.Author: Baybtt
Reviews.Content: I rated the value a 3 because I dont know what my employer paid for the room. The restaurant, bar, and lobby look great. The breakfast was average... The dinner was awesome. The rooms are spacious but kind of ugly. My color scheme was blue and red. I couldnt turn up the heat past a certain degree, there was a coffee machine without any cream or sugar, and the bathroom didnt have a vent. Other than that it was alright. Room service was affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Becky T
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, close to downtown, near to bars and restaurants. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The first room we got given had a really loud buzzing noise but we rang reception and they quickly moved us with no hassle. There were lots of little things that made this a really enjoyable experience - large room with modern decor, ipod dock in room, well equiped fitness center, computers for guest use. The bar/outside terrace on the 9th floor was a great feature with a nice view over the ballpark. We booked through booking.com and got a great deal so not only was it a real luxury but also reasonably priced. Personally the only downside I could find was the fact the hotel is so pet friendly which may put off people with allergies/dislikes of dogs.

Reviews.Title: “Location is key!”
Reviews.Author: gmailer1
Reviews.Content: really nice place to stay in SD,location is great, minutes from the baseball park and the gas lamp quarter,clean and friendly modern hotel with all the usual facilities, only down point to the hotel is the lack of free parking, however it does have valet parking but its $35 per night.

Reviews.Title: “They try hard and it works”
Reviews.Author: ctbjr1309
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night recently at this property. Received an upgrade to a Parlor Suite thanks to Priority Club Platinum status. We were warmly greeted at check in and upon leaving our car with the valet. In fact, the valet was so nice we almost didn't mind the $35 charge for valet parking. The room was great, the staff all very friendly and happy to answer questions and provide information. The hotel location in the Gaslamp district was great. Just a few short steps to bars, restaurants, shops, etc. Had a beautiful view of Petco Park out our window.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simon W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 7-10 Oct 2011. Got a King room on the 12th floor and it was very modern and clean. We had cupcakes in our room when we arrived which was a nice touch. Very close to gaslamp and close to shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tazzaha
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in the Gaslamp Quarter, with a lot of restaurants nearby. Our room was spacious and nicely decorated. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Our first room had a very dirty window, but when we mentioned this, the staff immediately arranged another room for us and apologized for the inconvenience. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “UTTERLY IMPRESSIVE!!”
Reviews.Author: Norm747
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews, but I had to for this hotel. The staff was extremely friendly, offering great local recommendations, directions and even discount coupons. You could tell that they genuinely cared and wanted to ensure that you're stay was nothing short of perfect. My wife and I had stayed for our anniversary. On the first night, the front desk had brought up complimentary sparkling wine and beverages along with a personalized card to congratulate us. The hotel was absolutely immaculate. The ambiance and decor was modern and slick with an infusion of nature. Can't say enough great things about the staff and this hotel. We will definitely stay there again. In fact, we are already planning our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Green Hotel Pays Dividends”
Reviews.Author: zonemanDanville
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Indigo twice over the past few weeks, and have nothing but positive things to say about it. My first stay was the night of the San Diego multi-hour power blackout. They were one of the few hotels in town that had power due to their own generators and solar.The bar, restaurant, lobb, eleveators, and hallways all had power. Indigo management made a stressful night quite livable. Crystal, the restaurant/bar manager did a great job keeping everyone happy. My next stay was for four nights the following week. The regular rooms, while small, are clean and comfortable. I moved to a suite that last two nights of my stay, and it was great. It had a beautiful view of Petco Park, and was quite spacious. I will strongly consider the Indigo for any future business or pleasure visits to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay at the Hotel Indigo”
Reviews.Author: Glendale_Sarah
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I really enjoyed my stay here this summer but I want to make sure that if you're reading this you note the following things which I just didn't pick up on 1. There's no pool or dedicated sun lounge area (yeah, there's a yoga deck, but not really a place to just lay out which is not associated with the bar area. If you're hoping to get away and zone out, I didn't really feel like there was a great spot to do this... 2. This place is super, super dog friendly. I'm a dog owner myself and loved the dog friendliness. However, I'm not sure I'd recommend this place to anyone who is NOT a dog fan since there were dogs of all sizes (and with all levels of obedience training) everywhere around the hotel Those disclaimers out of the way, I'll say that this is a hip, stylish hotel with friendly staff, good food, and within walking distance of a lot of attractions. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Boutique Hotel, Perfect Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: Andilulu
Reviews.Content: Hotel Indigo was quite lovely and we enjoyed our 2 night stay. We were in a perfect location to explore what downtown San Diego had to offer. We were walking distance to both the waterfront for daytime entertainment/exploration, and to the Gaslamp area for evening entertainment/exploration. We were so close to so much, we felt we didn't need to rent a car (and hence pay for parking!). The airport is only several miles away, a cab ride to the hotel was about $13.00, and there is also convenient bus service for $2.25 that goes directly to the airport. We had a nice corner room, with a view of Petco Park and also into downtown. The large windows provided an excellent view, and the curtains did an excellent job of blocking A.M. light. The bed was large and comfy, the desk area was ample, and the bathroom was HUGE! Double sinks, a very large shower, and nice Aveda toiletries. There was a Keurig machine provided for morning coffee/tea. The fitness area was of a reasonable size, and provided the basics. There was also a "meditation area" outside, next to the gym, which was a nice touch. The 9th floor lounge area is small, but a nice place to start your evening. The staff was efficent and friendly, particularly the bellman who assisted me with my luggage. I would definitely stay again when in town!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - excellent location - attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: claude52_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Indigo. The hotel isvey modern, the rooms are large, the staff very responsive to any requests. We would stay there anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SparrowsDream
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in San Diego and happened to be at Hotel Indigo during the 'great power outage' in September. The staff, and the property, handled this situation like pros! The staff went above and beyond to make our stay as comfortable as possible. If they are like this when the lights are out, imagine what it's like when the lights are on... The rooms were nice and clean, with hardwood floors and views of Petco Stadium that are hard to beat. Turns out we left something behind in our room and had no idea. Sergio, a very friendly staff member, contacted us and sent my item to me as a courtesy. Incredible!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL and here's why”
Reviews.Author: Joshblaylock
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at Hotel Indigo September 15-20th. We had a fabulous time. Here's why: VALET: There is no parking garage at Hotel Indigo but there is a valet. It costs $35/night. Yikes! I know that seems high but it's open 24 hours and the attendants are extremely professional and very fast. I honestly dont think I waited more than 3-5 minutes for the car each time. Also, they were extremely helpful with directions when asked. HOTEL & FRONT DESK: The hotel is really beautiful. When you walk in, you certainly have a regal boutique feel. The decorations are tasteful and up to date. The front desk was very friendly, quick yet attentive and helpful. David checked us in and he was very sweet. The lobby has two computers downstairs w/ free internet and free printing. This was helpful when I needed to print my plane ticket. They also have free internet in the room GYM: Decent sized gym. Exactly what we expected. Enough equipment for a quick workout and very clean. If you want a real gym there is one right around the corner called FIT. RESTAURANT: Kind of expensive but that's to be expected at a hotel restaurant. Strong drinks. Good food. THE ROOM: As you can see from the pictures I attached, the room was really gorgeous. We stayed in room 814 and I suggest requesting a CORNER room. The view of the stadium was really nice and the sunlight in the morning so wonderful. This is a dog friendly hotel but you would never know it. The floors are wooden which I LOVE so there is no dirty carpet smell. The bed comfortable and the linens extremely clean. Lots of channels to surf on the flat screen tv. The bathroom was big BUT the only only drawback was the shower. While it's a nice big walk in shower, the shower head looked kind of cheap and did not give off much water pressure which left you standing in one place trying to get wet and not freeze. They really need to put in a nicer rain forest shower head to fill up the space and make it more luxurious feeling. In terms of maid service, some of the other reviews Ive read says they didnt replenish or clean every day. This is a GREEN hotel people. You have to hang the "Please Service My Room" tag on the door knob when you leave for the day for them to come clean. LOCATION: The location is on the outskirts of the Gaslamp Quarter but honestly it's SO close in walking distance to all the bars at night etc. If you're gay, rent a car and it's a short distance to the Hillcrest area. No biggie. The area is very clean and a 5 minute walk from the stadium. All in all, I would recommend this hotel to anyone and we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Professionalism of Staff”
Reviews.Author: Peter T
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, great rooms. What really makes this hotel stand out however, is the exemplary professionalism of the staff. I stay in hotels approximately 180 days per year, and the Hotel Indigo staff is of the highest caliber. Always ready with a smile, knowledgable, articulate, and motivated, they provide a case study of how a hotel front desk should perform. Of particular note, Peyton stands out among her peers, a considerable challenge, given the abilities of her co-workers. Pete Captain, Jetblue Airways

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay - Excellent Location, Awesome rooms”
Reviews.Author: 84Shade85
Reviews.Content: Everything was great from start to finish - valets and front desk were really nice and helpful. It was handy that there were always taxis outfront, but it is so close to everything you only have to walk a couple blocks anyways. Our room was beautiful - way better than any of the pictures represented. It was clean, the bed was super comfortable. It is also nice that they have Aveda products instead of some cheap hotel brand. Overall it was awesome and I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and great location”
Reviews.Author: KatieCLee91
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the valets were really helpful and we had a very speedy check in. The room was very modern and clean, with a huge bed which was very comfortable. The hotel is quiet so we had a very restful night. The breakfast menu is limited, the fruit options were definately nicer than the bacon and egg choice (looked microwaved). All the staff were very friendly and the hotel has free wi-fi. Very pleasant stay and would definately return / reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lilaNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in summer 2010. It is a great location to restaurants, bars and the baseball stadium. They have a roof deck bar that is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cara C
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at Hotel Indigo. The location is perfect - right in the heart of the Gaslamp. The room was large, beautiful, and comfortable. The customer service was impeccable - from room service to the concierge. I highly recommend this hotel. The only negative experience we had was one morning we were woken up at 7am by a barking dog in a neighboring room. Overall, an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Holly S
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Indigo! The room was beautiful and the bed was very comfortable! It was within walking distance to most anything downtown in the Gaslamp district. We could actually see Petco park from our room! Fabulous stay! I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: adino
Reviews.Content: The room that was assigned to me overlooked the hotel's ventilation system and a large apartment building which made the room seem a bit dark. I asked if I could be transfered to a room with a view and the nice young lady who had greeted me offered a room in the front, much brighter but with two double beds instead of one king bed. Unfortunately, the safe deposit box was out of order. A janitor promptly came to repair it but could not, so I was moved again to the same exact room further down the hall, with a safe in good working order. The 3 rooms I visited had the same large and modern bathroom, with a large shower, plenty of plush towels, but no shower caps. The rooms are good-sized, with modern flat screen TV, coffee-maker, Ipod station, free wifi, many very comfortable pillows. One thing I really appreciated is that the windows open. Of course, I got to hear the - can you believe it - daily games at Petco Park next door, but that was lively. Everyone I dealt with was helpful and polite. If this hotel had a pool, it would be perfect. The bed was really great!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have given more stars.....except for that one thing!”
Reviews.Author: Treetop_67
Reviews.Content: First of all - Indigo is not really in the Gaslamp - it is just a few short blocks away in what is referred to as the East Village - but that did not really effect us. In fact I really like the location/neighborhood. It would be the must stay place if in town for a Padres game with a very cool gastropub (Knotty Barrel) across the street. The room was nice and clean - I really liked the wood floors. The whole reason we stayed here was because it was a LEED hotel and wanted to check that out. The one thing that people should be aware of is that it is a pet friendly hotel....that did not bother me - but it may some people if they have allergies or not into animals. There was some barking on our floor but it was not disruptive - but something to consider, again, if you are not an animal lover. We had a drink at the roof bar - great views - but limited selection. The staff was friendly and helpful from check in to the valet drivers. When we stayed there I was thinking that I was all set to give 4+stars, but then we had a negative situation with the management/housekeeping. Upon arriving at the airport my husband realized he left 2 shirts behind laying on the bed as he was packing. Yes, it is his fault that he forgot them - but he immediately called the hotel and they said he needed to email the manager of the lost and found as he was not working at that moment. He emailed him requesting that the shirts be mailed and that he would cover the cost for the shipping and any inconvenience this caused. When we did not hear back - so we called the hotel again and they said he was the person we needed to speak with and he was off. 2 days later we received a succint email saying the items were not found and to call the housekeeping manager if we had further concerns. We called her immediately and she said she did not have the items in her lost and found, but would check again and return my call. She did not return the call so I called again the next day and left a message and still we have never heard back from her. This was disappointing on many levels. Yes I realize that it was our responsibility to remember the items - however - we callled immediately and were sent through a lengthy process of days where obviously someone saw the items and claimed (stole) them. I find this very disturbing that the housekeepers or other employee would find it "okay" to take something left behind in a room. I understand if something goes unclaimed for weeks or months the hotel has to have a way to deal with the items, but we called the day we checked out, sent emails and followed up to no avail. It is not that the items were expensive or unique - it is more the principal of the matter and how poorly Hotel Indigo handled the situation. I think they may want to set a policy for their housekeepers/employees that taking something that is left behind by a paying guest is theft and not acceptable. So if not for that incident it would have been a 4 stars - but could not give more than the 2 stars because it left a bad taste in my mouth!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome - First time traveling alone...”
Reviews.Author: P S
Reviews.Content: Hey you... I booked a last minute trip to San Diego. What an awesome venue. The staff was very friendly and inforable. Always asking if I knew where to go and how to get there. Just a few blocks from the Gaslamp Dist. So many restaurants and shops to choose from. The rooms were Sweet... very comfortable and roomie, clean, pet friendly and I felt safe being alone. I will definetly go back. I have traveled all over the world and this is the first review I have written. It was that good. Ciao for now... Schatzie

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: HBGifford
Reviews.Content: My husband booked our stay at Hotel Indigo and I must say...It was AMAZING!! We brought our 16 month old collie and honestly, he was more welcome there than we were! LOL! Because of the friendly welcome we received upon arrival, we felt instantly comfortable. Our dog was welcomed with wonderful dog treats and the option of swimming in the doggie pool in the hotel's lounge!! Seriously, this place is the BEST place to bring your doggies!!! We can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: AnnaCasey
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel. If I didn't know it, I would never guess it was owned by Holiday Inn. It has a downtown boutique feel and attention to design that is very unusual in a chain. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The valet always asked us if we needed directions, and the gentleman who checked us out did the same, along with giving us a breakfast recommendation. The front desk called about 5 minutes after we arrived in the room to ask if everything was okay. The room rate was very reasonable for what we got: a huge room decorated in a lovely orange and blue color scheme, Keurig coffee maker, sleek, modern and VERY clean bathroom with lots of granite and beautiful tile in the huge walk-in shower with frameless glass door. Lots of little extras like a full size hair dryer, bottled water, an ipod docking station alarm clock (make sure to dim it before you fall asleep-- it's bright!)... and did I mention the view? We're Priority Club members, so they gave us a free upgrade to a king-sized room on the 8th floor with a view of Petco Park. Amazing. The elevators are fast and secure (you have to insert your room key to use them, which I liked), and the hotel is environmentally friendly. Apparently, it was the first hotel downtown that was ever LEED certified. The last night we were there, they slipped a letter under our door offering us to stay there the next night for only $99.00. Unfortunately, I had already booked another non-refundable room somewhere else, so this came a little too late, but we would have gone for it if we hadn't already made other arrangements. The only negatives I can think of: valet parking was pricey at $35 per night, but I'm guessing that's comparable to other hotels in the area. The bar on the 9th floor was a very nice atmosphere (incredible view) but I found the cocktail selection limited and very pricey (over $11 per drink). Again, though, perhaps that's comparable to other hotels in the area. The water in the shower didn't get very hot at 5:00 PM-- really only about lukewarm. I'm guessing that's because their hot water heaters are set on a timer to only heat at peak shower times. I appreciate the conservation aspects of that but dang, I really wanted that hot, pre-dinner shower since we'd been out walking around all afternoon. If you want to stay somewhere that feels a little more special than the run-of-the-mill hotel, but you don't want to pay Ritz prices, Hotel Indigo strikes a really happy medium. If I have the opportunity to visit the Gaslamp area of San Diego again, I will definitely stay be staying at Hotel Indigo.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Lied and Refused to Allow Guest to Check In”
Reviews.Author: jdhollinger
Reviews.Content: I called ahead to request permission for a member of our party to check in before we arrived. Permission was granted. When our guest arrived, she was not allowed to check in because she was not 21 years old. She was 18. We were a family of five. The guest was my daughter's best friend. I called and spoke to the manager on duty. He told me that California law prohibits hotels from checking in people under 21. Then he suggested that she check into another hotel. That raised a red flag. I did some research and discovered that the minimum age is 18. The manager simply lied to me and made our situation very difficult. Later, I spoke to the manager about my concern. He said they did nothing wrong and that I should have read the fine print on the website, which states the hotel's policy that people must be 21 to check in. Maybe so. Maybe he shouldn't have promised to admit a guest without asking the age. He certainly shouldn't have lied to me. On a positive note, he offered to bring a bed into the lobby so that our guest could stay the night in the hotel, just not in a room, should we have been unable to make it that night. Sweet!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia D
Reviews.Content: Wow I love your staff, they are the best. I am a JB flight attendant stuck to weather the latest storm in NY. Your staff provided excellent service. Paton stood out a lot to me because she told me all the info I needed for departing 2 days later. My Van time and check out time. She even called back to make sure I had everything I needed for my stay! Thank you for making a crew member fill at home.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it and very surprised with the quality and service we received. Planing to go back soon and stay longer.”
Reviews.Author: Mvirginia
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean, modern and very confortable.Hotel is a walking distance to restaurants, Seaport Village ,and Horton Plaza. I will recomend the hotel to family and friends. Employees are very friendly and helpful. If you park on the street, read all the signs to avoid a parking ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Still love this place....but please don't let the usual high standards slip”
Reviews.Author: Toaster803
Reviews.Content: Back again - believe this is the fourth visit in the last 12 months. Never tire of the location and design of this hotel. The rooms remain in excellent condition and are well maintained. My only grouse this time around were some silly mistakes by staff, mainly through miscommunication, that just took the edge off the quality service. However this hotel still remains firmly my top favourite for San Diego, and I will certainly be returning as soon as I can find an excuse.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the East Village”
Reviews.Author: MaryLS
Reviews.Content: Only a couple of blocks from the ballpark, the entrance to the hotel is not immediately obvious. The valet tucked in a corner near the front door is a give away. Inside the area is open with a restaurant bar to the right. The windows open bringing outside indoors. Room keys are necessary to operate the elevator except for the 9th floor where there is a bar, seating with fire pits and a view of the ballpark. Water bowls and food bowls are at the entrance and again at the bar as this is a animal friendly and LEED hotel. Locals often come here with their animals and everyone is friendly. The bartender even has some hidden treats for the dogs. Rooms are spacious with wooden floors. I like this so you do not have a carpet that you do not know what has been spilled on it and you are walking in your bare feet upon it! Valet parking is pricey but in and out privileges apply.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new fashionable hotel in the Gaslamp Quarter! Good value”
Reviews.Author: matsoc
Reviews.Content: The room was just great!!! View on the city and the stadium, great furniture, big HD TV, I-pod dock station, fabolous shower, excellent bed. The room and the bathroom were also very clean and big. The lobby and the rooftop bar are beautiful and fashionable. There was also live music and a lot of people coming just to the restaurant. The location is perfect in San Diego if you want to stay out at night. The night life is three minutes walk away. You can also see a baseball game in the stadium if the room is high enough... The only downsizes were the expensive valet parking and the breakfast, expensive and too small (it's better to do out breakfast if you are hungry!)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, energizing décor, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: viajerosivda
Reviews.Content: Hotel Indigo was everything a hotel should be. My husband and I stayed here for four days while in San Diego. The lobby is fresh and colorful, yet tranquil with a unique water feature streaming down from the ceiling. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The building is LEED-certified. The location was convenient for walking throughout the Gaslamp Quarter, to the waterfront, to a walking/running path, to nearby bus stops, or for short cab rides to Coronado or the zoo. Our room was bright, welcoming, and homey. The vibrant, fluffy bedding was cheerful and comfortable. I almost got lost in all of the pillows. I was actually inspired by the décor and would love for my home to look like this room. There was a privacy divider between the entryway and the bedroom part of the room. In the entryway, there was a console table, coffee maker, and mini-fridge. Wifi is free and the alarm clock had an iPod dock. The bathroom was spacious, including a very large countertop on the sink vanity. Aveda products were complimentary. Unlike most hotels, the room included ample mirrors with a large anti-fog mirror in the bathroom, and a full-length mirror on the closet door. The closet was stocked with plenty of wooden hangers, an iron and full ironing board, and a safe on the shelf that was large enough to fit our laptops, SLR cameras, etc. Most exciting for my husband, our window had a perfect view into Petco Park. Lucky for him, the Padres played four home games while we were in town. We attended one game and he was able to catch portions of the others from our room’s window. The rooftop bar on the ninth floor also has an excellent view of the stadium. We did not eat any meals at the hotel, as there were too many delicious restaurants to try while we were in town. If I had to offer a negative, my only complaint would be that housekeeping was slow to clean our room. The first day, it was cleaned by early afternoon. The other two days, we had to call and ask for service as it had not been cleaned by about 3pm and we were heading out for the afternoon/evening. If I return to San Diego, I would love to stay at Hotel Indigo again and I highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating for families traveling with pets”
Reviews.Author: snroberts
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our reservation several months ago, and a week before our trip to San Diego, we added a four-legged member to our family...our basset hound Milo. We didn't want to leave Milo at home after just adopting him, and I remembered that the hotel has a pet policy. So I called and spoke to Melissa, who was terrific. Melissa spent quite a bit of time on the phone with me explaining my options, and then took time on her own to contact local vendors who would be able to take care of Milo for a couple of hours while we visited Petco Park. Melissa ultimately found a service that would take Milo out for a walk. While at the hotel, we were provided doggie food and water bowls. The hotel itself has a terrace with a doggie wading pool and a grassy area for the pet to do his/her business. They provide mess clean-up bags too. Full service for both humans and pets. The room is very spacious, the bed very comfortable and the location perfect if you want to tour around the Gaslamp District...and right down the street from Petco Park. I'd return without hesitation. This is the second time I've stayed at this awesome hotel and it won't be the last. We've had nothing but positive experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service All Around”
Reviews.Author: Mary C
Reviews.Content: We had a flood in our downtown San Diego condo and had to stay at a hotel for over two weeks until our condo was fully repaired. The service at Hotel Indigo was impeccable: if we called for coffee, towels, maid service, room service, etc., not only did we get what we requested within minutes, but the front desk would call to reconfirm we got our orders. The staff is naturally friendly and accommodating. The rooms are nice and the upstairs outdoor lounge is really refreshing with a great view to catch some fresh air and have a cocktail. This is a great hotel for business travelers, families, a couple's weekend get-a-way, or a long-term stay. Best of all, it is overly pet-friendly and would recommend it over ANY other pet-friendly hotel in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in SD gaslamp area”
Reviews.Author: DirkTid
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great area! Also, I believe the value for money is generally better than other hotels in the area. Two caveats: 1) the hotel is dog friendly, which I love but others might not, 2) other reviews complained about noise from some younger guests. I had no problem with noise and loved the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One day-not enough”
Reviews.Author: Stella78
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Only wish I had been there a few more days. The room was very clean and the bathroom was spotless. The only drawback was we asked for a room away from the elevators but were placed right next to them-the hotel was booked for a conference so they couldn't accommodate our request. It was a little loud because of this but at night we turned on our white noise machine so it helped. The bed was firm and comfortable and the wood floors were nice and clean. Bathroom was huge and the shower had a good flow to it. Wireless in room was good. Good ambiance in the lobby complete with guests' dogs which was great because for a hotel that allows dogs it sure is kept spotless and odorless. The location of the hotel was great. Walking distance to many restaurants and shops. The weather wasn't the greatest when we were there and they ran out of umbrellas because guests weren't returning them. Would be great if they could have an umbrella in each room in case someone needs one-the airlines lost my bag so I was without my rain jacket. Check in and out was good and both receptionists were very friendly and helpful. But after checking out we sat for 25 minutes with our bags waiting for the valet to get our car. They didn't appear busy at all so when we finally went up to talk to them told us they had forgotten about us. That was pretty bad service, especially because we were in a hurry and they weren't apologetic at all. Would have preferred a better last impression of a place that had given great service up until the end.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, but Expected More...”
Reviews.Author: BAToland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 11-Aug-2011 through 17-Aug-2011. When we arrived later in the evening on 11-Aug, we were promptly greeted by a very friendly employee. We thought that this friendly service with a smile would continue throughout our trip, but we were wrong. Based on all of the reviews on this site, we expected to be greeted each day with a smile and asked if we needed anything, but it did not happen after the first night. We would walk in after returning from an excursion or dinner, and the staff would not even look our way. It was very disappointing! However, this was one of the cleanest hotels that we have ever stayed in. The bedding was clean, and the room was expertly cleaned each day. That is a super plus for us - we cannot stay in dirty hotel rooms! Other Pros - near Petco Park, near Gaslamp, free wifi, free printing, very animal friendly (though we did not have an animial with us). Other Cons - no swimming pool, not given towels, washcloths, and/or toiletries on more than one occasion, restaurant and bars close early (10:00 pm), expensive parking, staff unable to provide suggestions for places to eat or excursions to take. Would I stay here again? If I had to, it would be fine. If I could choose, probably not.

Reviews.Title: “We totally loved it and definately will be back”
Reviews.Author: Sandra B
Reviews.Content: We had never been here before and decided to stay here d/t the closeness of Petco Park. The staff went above and beyond the call of duty to make sure we were happy and satisfied. We travel with our small dog and the facility couldn't have been more accomodating to us or our baby dog. We will definately be back

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay here even if we didn't have a dog!!!”
Reviews.Author: Renee Z
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. We were searching the internet for a dog friendly hotel in San Diego and came upon the Hotel Indigo. We booked a room for 2 nights and loved it so much that we added another night. First of all, the hotel is extremely new, modern and CLEAN! The lobby, open-air restaurant and 9th floor rooftop bar/terrace were beautiful. Our dog was welcome in any part of the hotel--even the restaurant. We especially liked the fact that even if our dog, Jake, had to go out in the middle of the night, we didn't have to leave the property as there is a grassy doggy area on the 9th floor rooftop terrace for him. Our room was beautifully decorated, comfortable and extremely clean. We loved the hotel location--a few minutes walk to the Gaslamp district. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant one night and it was very good. It was also nice to go to the 9th floor bar/rooftop lounge for an after-dinner drink at the end of an evening. We spent every day at the dog beach on Coronado Island and the hotel was a very easy 15-minute drive away. The staff couldn't have been more accommodating--the front desk even greeted Jake by name! All in all, this hotel is a gem. We can't imagine staying anywhere else whenever we visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Andrew41009
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from the Hotel Indigo and our stay was perfect. We were warmly greeted by the valet, and we received immediate attention from the bellman. The bellman who assisted us, his name was Sergio, and this man truly understands the meaning of service. Sergio noticed we were travelling with our two year old daughter, and he immediately asked if we needed anything for the baby after a long drive. Sergio quickly unloaded all of our luggage and did it with a smile. We were greeted at the front desk by Darren. Darren was also very helpful and courteous, and made sure we had everything we needed. Sergio and Darren have to be two of the nicest people I have ever encountered working in the hotel industry. The service did not stop there. Our bags were brought to our room quickly, along with the assurance that if we needed anything just to call the front desk. Throughout our stay, the front desk would ask if we needed anything, and always called to ensure that items we had requested had arrived. The food and service in the restaurant was on par with the rest of the property. The restaurant staff was very accommodating and always made sure we had everything we needed. During our stay, the hotel was sold out. We had no issues with noise, and the hotel was very clean and orderly. This is a well run property. with a motivated staff of employees, like Sergio, who go above and beyond. I admit that I had some fear after reading the reviews of other guests. We would return to this property again and again, and would be glad to recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Refused to change reservation due to death in the family”
Reviews.Author: gerry021
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel through an online booking service with a rate that was not refundable or changeable. That's fine, I understand that certain low rates come with restrictions and limitations. However, the hotel refused a request to change my arrival date by 2 days so I could attend my father's funeral. I think this shows an astounding lack of sensitivity or customer service - how can you stand behind corporate policy to this degree? I don't know if the Indigo hotel management could not or would not make a change - or if it was an Intercontinental corporate order. Regardless, I will never again stay at any Intercontinental property and urge you to avoid them as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Timmy00
Reviews.Content: Modern, New, Stylish and central to San Diego and the Gaslamp area. Rooms are modern and the showers are huge. Ask for a room overlooking the Ball Park as you can see the games out the window. On the 9th floor there is also a rooftop deck that you can sit in sun loungers and see the baseball games. Also recommend you take a late night walk to 5th St and go to the Ghradelli chocolate Store and get an ice cream!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!! Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Jorge M
Reviews.Content: If you always look for the best and like to treated the same look no further. I loved this place. Everything I could have hoped for!

Reviews.Title: “Great for dogs, Very Good for people”
Reviews.Author: f00die12
Reviews.Content: When we made our reservation, Hotel Indigo was #1 in San Diego on TripAdvisor. It is not the best hotel in town! I would describe it as above average. Service was fine, the rooms were clean and the 9th floor lounge and 1st floor reception areas were beautiful. On the downside, overnight parking was expensive, the beds were hard and the hotel is several blocks removed from the heart of the Gaslamp District, which is where we wanted to be. Our request for early check in was flatly rejected, as was a request to stay one hour longer than standard check out time. We were also very disappointed to learn that the hotel pool was only for dogs! The hotel was good, but not spectacular. Would I stay there again? Sure. But I'd go in with more realistic expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in SD”
Reviews.Author: ConstantTravelerVA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Indigo for a night. Modern ambiance, look and facilities. The room was definitely worth the price. The staff was courteous and helpful; the internet was free and it was close to Gas Lamp restaurants and the convention center. A modern, boutique-looking hotel. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nicely appointed”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_McGee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 2 blocks from the baseball park and also an easy walk to the restaurants in the gaslamp quarter. Very pretty room with hardwood floors and contemporary decor. Pet friendly, there is a little patch of grass on the terrace bar level for your dogs to do their business. Nice terrace bar to relax and have a drink in the evenings. It was cool when we were there and they had heat lamps and fire pits going. I would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Melissa at the front desk and the whole staff in general”
Reviews.Author: Jason_in_NYC
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to take a few minutes to commend the AMAZING staff at the Hotel Indigo in downtown San Diego, I had the pleasure of interacting with the front desk staff and was especially thrilled to have dealt with Melissa. She was kind, considerate and extremely helpful to this lost New Yorker. She was patient and took the time to explain the city and give me directions to where I needed to go. She even printed out a bus schedule for me - going way above and beyond in my opinion! I am a flight attendant and stay at over 250 hotels a year, and my experince with the Hotel Indigo by far ranks in the top 5! I'm also in the businees of customer service, so I really appreciate it when I receive excellent service. Melissa and her staff blew me away with their friendliness and helpful nature - and I'm not easily impressed! Thank you Melissa for your help and excellent service - it was MY pleasure to stay at Hotel Indigo and look forward to returning and seeing your smiling face again! Warm regards, Jason Trexler

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room & location ruined by poorly managed staff”
Reviews.Author: Bibelot44
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Indigo for three nights of seaworld, baseball and sightseeing. The location is wonderful and the hotel and rooms are very nice, modern, clean and well kept. The front desk staff was nice upon check in and out. The maid service was ok, I suppose. They didn't seem to want to replenish the soaps and shampoos thinking that those tiny bottles would last two people three nights. Making the bed consisted of pulling the sheets and blankets up and piling on the numerous pillows which left a lumpy look to what was a very nice bed. They left used paper coffee cups and glasses on the tables where I or my daughter left them. I guess cleaning or replacing used cups and/or glasses was not part of the maid service. Sometimes they replaced the bottle of water in the room, sometimes they didn't. The shock about that bottle of water is that it cost $5! No where did it say they would charge for that water, there is no mini bar, so I assumed it was complementary to the room just like the coffee and tea so imagine my surprise to see a charge to my credit card after I get home for a $5 bottle of water! When I called to ask what the $5 charge was for, the very rude man who was answering the phone huffed and puffed and sighed at the terrible inconvenience i was putting him through. When I asked who was supposed to tell me that there was a charge for the water or where was it supposed to say as such, he said it should have been on the bottle and that he could remove the charge and hung up. So, we will see if it is removed.. something tells me it will not be. At least they got the $35 per night charge for valet parking correct.... The valets were nice and efficient even though somehow my car got some nice scratches and dings from them opening other doors onto mine. Before calling to inquire about the extra charge to my account, I would have stayed there again. Now, I am not too sure. Too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and trendy hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: hardrockingirl
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled to have booked a good deal on this hotel through Hotwire because the reviews and pictures of the property were great. Also the location was perfect. The lobby, downstairs restaurant, the business center, and even the lobby bathroom were stunning and modern. Our room was too, with a spacious and elegant bathroom. We were amazed by the view from our room. We overlooked Petco park and even Coronado bridge. The 9th floor bar had a great view of Petco park and the bay. It also was beautifully decorated and had comfy seats to sip a cocktail and enjoy the view. Service was great. Everyone from the front desk to the valet was super nice, polite, and accommodating. Free wi-fi! Hard to find in hotels these days... Now for a few minor problems... Cocktails and food were overpriced for what they were, even during happy hour. I would have spent a lot more time on the 9th floor bar if the prices were more reasonable. I saw a few people in the elevator taking cans of Coors light up to the bar, but I didn't know if that's allowed... $35 a night for parking! I know everyone complains about it but I'm still trying to let it sink in that I payed over $100 for 3 nights of parking. We saw a lot nearby that was $10 a night, but I didn't know how safe it was, and it seemed like kind of pain that we would have to walk 3 blocks every time to get our car. Luckily, valet staff was quick getting our car and they are very nice. Noisy. Walls have to be super thin or something. I did not sleep well at all the entire time I was there, despite the extremely comfy bed. I heard doors slamming, babies crying, construction in the early AM, people talking. Room service hours. I was reading the information book in my hotel room and the book said they have 24 hour room service. We walked back from a bar a little after midnight and were hungry. We were thinking of trying to find a place to eat but I remembered reading that they have 24 hour room service so we decided to go back and order something. I called the room service number and they said the kitchen is closed! Why does it say 24 hour room service in their book? Despite these minor issues, we had an amazing stay at Hotel Indigo and can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Overnight baseball trip”
Reviews.Author: cjm73
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night but I was very impressed. The hotel was very quiet and clean. I stayed the night to attend a Padres game. The hotel is about two blocks behind centerfield, north of the stadium. My room had a view of the stadium and there is also an outdoor terrace bar on the 9th floor that faces the stadium. Although slightly removed from the action, it is still a great vantage point to catch the action!! Very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noise spoils an otherwise attractive property”
Reviews.Author: W0X0F
Reviews.Content: Summary: This Hotel Indigo (it's a chain, part of IHG) came across as an overpriced Holiday Inn, rather than as a value-priced luxury hotel. The decor is attractive, with (apparently) wood floors, cool earthy colors, and modern bath furnishings and electronics. But a hotel room is first and foremost a place to sleep, and that's where this one fails to hit the mark. Noise, or rather, lack of adequate soundproofing between rooms appears to be the culprit. Every door closing, every conversation in the hallway was clearly audible (and I do mean clearly--we learned way too much about our floormates' personal lives). TVs in adjoining rooms were not as clearly audible, but the bass came thumping through. And those hardwood floors? It means any time some in the room above dropped something hard or walked across in a hard-soled shoe, we got to hear it. Street noise, even on a higher floor, was also quite strongly heard in the room. Second problem: the bed was a reasonably firm one, but as a king-size, it still had four small and unpleasantly foamy pillows, the kind I'd expect at a Holiday Inn Express, instead of the large, cushy pillows I'd expect at an upscale hotel. No extra blankets or pillows in the closet. The bathroom was attractive, but had no tub, just a walk-in shower, which I actually prefer but not all do. There were no washcloths when we checked in, and no floor mat the next day. Wet tile floors, whee! No robes provided, another common amenity for a true upscale hotel. The much-advertised views of Petco park are oversold. The park is two full blocks away from the hotel, so one is looking between other buildings into the park. It's more interesting than looking at more high-rises, but don't think you'll really be watching a game from your room, at least not without serious magnification. Lobby and bell staff were friendly when approached directly, but otherwise detached. Never a "good evening" or "welcome back", even when they weren't otherwise occupied. Someone in management is still thinking too down-scale. IHG needs to put some line staff from Intercontinental in place to touch up service. Even then, the main problems are structural. I'll be looking for somewhere else next time I need to be in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel with Superb Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: VikkiVJ
Reviews.Content: Although my trip was cut short due to other commitments the time I did spend here I thoroughly enjoyed. Decor awesome. Location fantastic. Staff caring and attentive. Room spotless and fully equipped. Don't ask me for any negatives because I truly don't have any.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Macale86
Reviews.Content: Steps away from Petco Field, walking distance from great restaurants and entertainment. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Hotel is very clean and well maintained. We travelled with our two children and would absolutely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: rbride
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Indigo was very nice, has a great location, one block from PETCO park for the Padres game, and within walking distance to the Gaslamp Quarter, and about a 5-10 minute drive to Balboa Park and the Zoo. I had a room with a comfy king size bed, which was very spacious, had a very large bathroom and glorious shower. The WifI in the room was nice to have to check out directions to local hot spots. The 9th floor terrace bar was great. I sat up there twice and had drinks by the fire pit and watched the Padre game. No room refrigerator and parking was pricey, but this is a great hotel and the staff was very friendly and welcoming. The room rates are high, but I took advantage of a deal on Travel Zoo, and would definitely stay again. A plus for pet owners is the hotel allows dogs. I assume the hotel has rooms set aside for dog owners, but if not, I could not locate any signs my room had previous pet guests (odor, fur, fleas, etc) thankfully. Great Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience, best kept secret in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Cdn_biz_traveller008
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - new but with character and charm, excellent staff, spacious and well thought out rooms. Centre of Gas Lamp Quarter close to Petco Park. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Contracts be danged - they will do anything to get your money”
Reviews.Author: kammVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Indigo during Comic Con, and booked as they required through Travel Planners. I amended my stay from six nights to five before the change deadline, but was told upon checkout I needed to pay over $300 for the night I was no longer staying. Even a printed copy of the contract and two representatives from Travel Planners telling them not to charge us would not sway them. Citing a lack of authority to uphold our contract (through three levels of staff) I was repeatedly urged to pay, leave and dispute it later. Eventually, they said they'd call with a decision as to whether they would charge me. The front desk clerk was rude (actually waved away my comment that housekeeping didn't clean my room one night) and she wandered off and left us at the desk after Travel Planners called the front desk to tell them they were obligated not to charge us. It took two hours before they finally agreed to abide by the contract - and they complained to us that they had "issues" with the travel company as if I should be involved in that. It was a horrible end to our trip and a short-sighted money grab as we are frequent travellers who will never go to any Hotel Indigo again. Oh yeah, the night before we left they slipped a flyer under our door trying to get us to stay the night we'd cancelled for $99 - but were insisting we pay $300+ for not staying. Truly the most appalling mismanagement of a non-issue I have ever come across. I'd stay in a hostel before staying there again - and I am telling everyone I can about how poor their customer service is. Stay somewhere, anywhere, else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Very Pet Friendly”
Reviews.Author: DiscoStick
Reviews.Content: Overall a really good hotel. We stayed the middle of July when there also happened to be a three game series against the Giants. The only negative I can say, and it's not the hotels fault, is the noise from the games was pretty bad with the proximity to Petco Park being so close. Especially the one night when there were fireworks. Besides this issue everything was fantastic. We brought our two boxers and they were very welcome here. The hotel gave us water bowls for each and even a big box of treats complimentary. The terrace on the ninth floor had a grassy area where they could go to the bathroom and that was also very convenient. The room itself was nice and the location was good (especially if you're looking to go to Petco Park!) I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: divin1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a conference at the San Diego Convention Center. Very short walk to Petco Park ballpark and easy walking to many restaurants, shops and pubs in downtown, along the Harbor and on 5th Avenue. Also close to Horton Plaza shopping center. Room was modern and very clean with a very comfortable bed. Good size bathroom with shower only, no tub. Hotel has a roof deck on the 9th floor where you can have a drink and see into the ball field. Great viewing for the fireworks when they have them at Petco. Small gym and meditation area on the premises. Restaurant and bar in the lobby with cool windows that open up to the outside.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with good friends!”
Reviews.Author: jimnkim91
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for nine days while we were in San Diego celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary, and we cannot make enough positive comments about how wonderful the Hotel Indigo San Diego-Gaslamp Quarter is. From the warm reception at the front desk by Peyton and Adonia when we walked in the door to the anything-I-can-do-to-make-your-stay-enjoyable attitude from Sergio, we really did feel like we were staying with old friends, and within a day, we were old friends! In keeping with the nicely integrated Petco Park (home of the San Diego Padres) just a block away, Dieter and David and the rest of the front desk team have hit one out of the park. So many hotels these days have forgotten how important the initial reception is when you arrive, so it was refreshing to see that that was not the case here. And even better yet, that was only the beginning of an overall pleasant stay. The hotel amenities are well above what you would expect from this price point in downtown San Diego, the location is perfect for walking to the Gaslamp, Convention Center and the up & coming East Village area, and the Table 509 "lounge" off the lobby has a surprisingly nicely stocked bar where Matt and Crystal have the same great attitudes we received from the reception desk (be sure to visit the 9th floor lounge - the view alone is worth it). I know that next time I am in San Diego, this is where I am staying! And an added bonus for our four-legged friends: this is one of the most pet-friendly hotels in which we have ever stayed. Do not be alarmed if there are a couple of dogs behind the front desk - guests are encouraged to keep them there if they are going somewhere (like to eat) where pets are not permitted.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh Design, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Ters012
Reviews.Content: This hotel is still very new in its condition. I really like the contemporary style of the lobby, but its design does not particularly showcase the spirit of San Diego, which is the goal of each Indigo in every unique locale I assume? The property is within walking distance from restaurants and bars which is very convenient. If you get a room on a high enough floor, you could see inside the baseball stadium nearby. The designs of the rooms and bathroom are unique and modern and the lighting adds even more to the atmosphere. Good place to stay for the business traveler who is looking for something fresh, unique, and out of the ordinary from the cookie cutter business hotels. Service was good. Staff was polite. Rooms were clean. Bathrooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ta060
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the stay at Hotel Indigo. The rooms were very modern and stylish and we liked that it was a green hotel. We ate at the restaurant off the lobby and had room service and the food was excellent. We also had drinks at the 9th floor rooftop lounge which has a great view. I used the fitness facility and it was nice but not a lot of equipment. It was very clean and I liked the small meditation area outside. The hotel is in a great area, in walking distance to restaurants and nightlife. The hotel is extremely dog friendly which was fine with me as I like dogs but be advised they are welcome everywhere in the hotel:)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Honest-Jim
Reviews.Content: I have always been keen to try this brand of the IHG as we don’t have them in the UK (might be one in London now). I thought it was great. Everything about it I enjoyed. It is (as its name implies) within a few minutes walk of the heart of the Gaslamp district. The location in fact is very good, with many attractions within easy reach (eg a 15 minute walk to USS Midway) The lobby was smart, modern and clean, and this theme continued into the bedrooms, which were very pleasant indeed; the bathroom is modern and attractive, with a very roomy shower. There is no bath, but we prefer showers. Complimentary wifi was a plus point, and the Ipod / Iphone docking station was a very welcome feature. The outside bar on the 9th floor complete with fire pits was a very pleasant environment in which to enjoy a drink. The only disappointment here was the fact that drinks are dispensed in plastic containers! We had breakfasts in the dining area – these were very good, and good value for money (eg I got 2 fried eggs, bacon and potato for just under $10). Overall, an excellent stay, and represented good value for money. I wouldn’t hesitate in recommending it, and would definitely stay again. I was very pleased to note that my Priority Club Platinum Membership was fully recognised! Much appreciated. It fully deserves its high ranking on Tripadvisor

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: RaisinBran
Reviews.Content: Indigo is in a perfect location a few blocks outside of Gaslamp. My husband and I came here for 4th of July weekend with our pup. This hotel was great for us and our pup, it's incredibly dog friendly & so is the staff. We have an 85lb. Retriever. Check out the roof deck bar, that's a must!! Surprisingly got an awesome deal for the stay on hotelplanner.com. We thought being a holiday weekend we would pay high rates.

Reviews.Title: “A fresh, modern and trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peltt
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Indigo did not get off to a good start when we realised the valet parking was the only suitable option in the neighbourhood and the cost was a significant addition to the total bill. It did not get better on entering our room as it suffered from loud throbbing mechanical noises from above that would have made sleep impossible. After realising the noise was permanent, we called the front desk and fortunately we were offered a different room on a lower floor. After that, our stay was very pleasant. We enjoyed the central location, the view from our room and the big windows, the amount of space we had, and the trendy decor and furnishings. The lobby had convenient internet access. Best of all were the friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: CoopersMom40
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay-- 9 th floor scenic bar was awesome-- breakfast was excellent- a bit noisy for sleeping( you can hear footsteps above you - lots of creaks and noises) but I will bring my sound machine next time-- great location-

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, incredible service!”
Reviews.Author: DaveRiser
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the best hotels I've stayed at! I arrived at the hotel after a 5 hour train ride and was greeted by a friendly and professional bellman who escorted me straight to the desk. David was amazing during my check in process. He spent the time talking face to face with me rather than looking down at the screen... It seemed very personal and made me feel like I was more than just a reservation number. Shortly after checking in I received a phone call from David asking if the room was alright and that he also found my Priority Club number and attached it to my reservation!!! THANK YOU! My room was on the 8th floor and had an amazing view. Who every cleaned my room is an asset to that hotel. I've stayed at many hotels, and you tend to inspect the room just to make sure nothing is wrong... I could NOT find one thing that was wrong with this room. The floor was spotless, the linens were perfect, everything is the bathroom sparkled. I felt like I was the first person to ever stay in that room. Every time I left the hotel and came back from a meeting I was greeted and felt welcomed. I don’t really have time to do reviews, but this hotel deserves it. The staff is awesome, the hotel immaculate, and my stay was unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: mariah41
Reviews.Content: Guest relations unavailable to help with unanswered questions. No towels available, air conditioner not working in beautiful room and it was scorching hot in July, noisy streets for 2 nights, it was a very bad experience for such a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Comfortable, Friendly -- Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Reefwatcher
Reviews.Content: Hotel Indigo is just off the heart of the Gaslamp district -- close enough for easy walking, and far enough away to minimize street noise around the hotel. The property is hip and modern, with a rooftop bar where you can look right down on Petco Park while you enjoy a cocktail. I decided not to fight the parking issue; if you want to stay in a downtown, city hotel, accept the reality of valet parking costs, or stay elsewhere. The valet service was pleasant and quick; I never had to wait long for my car. My room was spacious and clean, and the bed was excellent -- combined with the surprisingly quiet a/c, I got some of the best sleep I've ever had in a hotel room. The bathroom is modern and attractive, with a very roomy shower, plenty of towels, and a great hair dryer. My only criticism would be that, despite the "green" emphasis and request that guests re-use towels (which is always fine with me), there was only one towel hook -- not a rack or bar anywhere -- making it pretty difficult to dry towels for re-use. In-room coffee was the "cup at a time" system, and the maid did keep me well supplied with coffee pods... but I find it wasteful and silly to generate plastic trash for every cup of coffee. Again, this is a hotel which prides itself on its LEED certification, so I find that perplexing. There was good closet space, plenty of real hangers, an IPod docking station, free WiFi, an in-room safe, and a free business center in the lobby. The decor was cool and attractive, there was good natural light, and a window that actually opened -- rare in hotels. I also appreciated the security of the keycard-controlled elevator. I was probably most impressed by the staff at the Indigo. From check-in to check-out, they were genuinely friendly and service-oriented. I ate one breakfast at Table 509; the food was quite good and the service was excellent. If you want to stay in the Gaslamp area of San Diego, I think this is an excellent hotel choice, and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: 606zpx
Reviews.Content: Fairly well located about 1.5 blocks from Petco Park. Area pretty safe. Close to Gaslamp. Room is large as well as bathroom. Very clean. Keurig coffee maker. Downside: No fridge. I like to keep drinks without having to fetch ice and so forth. No complimentary breakfast. I scored a government rate that simply could not be beat. I saved so much, I could have bought my own fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: my_red_dress
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, close to everything: walking distance to the gaslamp district. They not only accept dogs but really cater to them as well. Loved the 9th Floor grass area for dogs so they can do their business! Best hotel we've ever stayed in when bringing the dogs! Will definately go here next time we come to San Diego. Got a really great rate, had to pre-pay to get it though but if you know you are definately going it is the hot ticket!

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: Thinkdiesel
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised, A+ hotel service from the valet runners to the front desk. They always had a smile and was ready to assist anything. The room was great, modern and clean, a definite change from my normal sheraton and marriot. Wished we stayed in a better room with a view. Only downside I can think of is no rooftop pool for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service!”
Reviews.Author: serpinb9
Reviews.Content: We checked in and entered our room at about 4pm and found that there were no towels anywhere in the room. We called the front desk immediately and asked for them to be brought up as we were tired and needed to shower. Two hours and four more phone calls later, still no towels....we ended up using the hair dryer to dry ourselves. No explanation or apology was ever given, the front desk even sounded annoyed by our calls. No towels, but well stocked with hair dryers and toilet paper to dry yourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, great service.”
Reviews.Author: danielelliotgreen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are here on our honeymoon and it has been awesome. We did have a few unexpected setbacks, but the hotel has been amazing at resolving issues and even hooked us up with some upgrades. The service here is great! Parking has been the biggest issue we've dealt with. The hotel doesn't offer free parking. They do offer valet parking for $35 a night, which stinks. And parking overnight on the street is kind of a hassle because of the street sweeping schedule. We did manage to find a few parking garages only a few blocks away. The most we've paid for overnight parking there has been $11. All in all, we're really enjoying our experience here and would definitely recommend the hotel to anybody wanting to visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TucsonDave
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Hotel Indigo. The hotel is located just a few blocks from the Gaslamp Quarter in one direction, Petco Park in another and the up and coming East Village neighborhood in another. We had a standard room which is good sized with a very large bathroom and large shower. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is dog friendly which you notice as soon as you arrive as they have a large bowl of water out front for their 4 legged guests. While we did not bring a dog, we noticed a large number of residents in the area walking their dogs and taking them to the grassy area outside the right field fence of Petco Park. There is a nice lounge on the 9th floor of the hotel. We were told that it makes an excellent fireworks viewing area on Friday nights after a Padres game. My one issue with the Hotel Indigo is with the $35/night valet parking fee. The hotel is very nice, and it couldn't be in a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but won't return”
Reviews.Author: Umba
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is really nice, great rooms with comfortable beds & nice bathroom. The restaurant was good too, we ate breakfast there and had a really gorgeous cocktail in the bar. The only problem we had was that our room was over the bar/restaurant area and on our last night the hotel held a party there which kept us awake all night. Had we have been notified about the party then we would have stayed out later until after the party had finished. We did call down to the reception to complain, I'm not sure if the person that answered the call could even hear us the music was so loud so we just had to wait it out until the party was over. When we checked out the following morning the hotel did offer us a refund of one days valet parking which was fine but I would have prefered to have known about the party in the first place so I could have made other arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Iain Y
Reviews.Content: I had previously attended a conference in San Diego and wanted to return with my wife. I was very happy that I chose this hotel, which was just a short walk from the Gaslamp district away. The room was just perfect - clean, comfortable, The staff were attentive without being intrusive. They always greeted you when walk in and all of the staff were very friendly. We only ate in the hotel for breakfast but the food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “spacious and attractive room, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: capitol_couple
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference in Marina area and very happy that I chose this hotel (gov rate), which was just a short walk through the Gaslamp district away. The room was just perfect - clean, comfortable, colorful (felt like a nicer version of home). Someone always greets you when walk in and all of the staff were very friendly. I was also pleased with the breakfast and drinks at the hotel restaurant/lounge. I became "stranded" trying to get back to the east coast during some big snowstorms and everyone was very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: velezmar
Reviews.Content: We visites the Indigo because we catch a great rate in hotwire. When we arrived we had a very pleasant surprise, the lobby is so beautiful, with a fountain, nice blue colors, and the best staff you can imagine. We arrived at 9 oclock so we thought we didnt get a room until later, we were wrong, they gave us the room right away, the room is very very spacious, ecen the bathroom its like twice the size of a holiday inn. Everything is great, the comfortable beds, linens, towels, LCD tv, etc. Now the location, is two blocks from the main streets, with great restaurants, and stores, also 2 blocks from the trolley. It was and awesome experience, and the rate was very good for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Time - Can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: BMillane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Indigo for my birthday. Not only did they upgrade our rooms but the staff became our friends. They were so accommodating & fun to get to know. We'll be heading back soon for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: wilcodis
Reviews.Content: When you stay regularly in a hotel, you start to wonder after a while what the differences are between the one hotel room and the other. Bed, TV, shower. Hotel Indigo made me newly acquainted with a hotel stay. We both loved it. The rooms are modern and fancy and so are the bathrooms. It just has this touch that most hotels seem to miss. Apart from all this, it's in one of the best locations in town and a 3 minute walk to the heart of the gas lamp quarter. The only thing that I would improve is the size of the breakfast portions. One scrambled egg and 2 pieces of toast for about $ 10 is a little over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: JillandJohn012
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Indigo purely on it's excellent Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed. We had a corner suite that was unbelievably large with views over Petco Park. Everything about this hotel was great-location,staff,friendliness and cleanliness Breakfast menu while not extensive, was very well done. Loved the yoghurt parfait Would stay there again anytime

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, location, & service !”
Reviews.Author: JoeJoeOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: My Team in Training group from Miami staying here for the San Diego Marathon Weekend, and we really enjoyed this hotel! Walking to everything in downtown was easy: ballpark, convention center, gas lamp's night life, and Seaside Village. The hotel is totally clear, the rooms were very nice & comfortable, and the staff help us feel welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Super Cool Contemporary Hotel in Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: inneedofavaca
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a suite that overlooked the San Diego Padres stadium. The rooms were big, hotel is new, and staff was really nice and helpful. There is also a rooftop bar with a great view of downtown. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “No hot water”
Reviews.Author: McBaw
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very modern, clean, nice decor Cons: No hot water- I informed the front desk two times. Both times I was asked if I let the water run long enough to get hot.
